subsection.leadIn: Subsection (11) shall not apply to any stock borrowing or stock return, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an executed copy of the stock borrowing and lending agreement under which the stock borrowing and stock return are provided for, or a copy of the stock borrowing and lending agreement which is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector as a true copy thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such fee as may be specified by the Financial Secretary for the purposes of this subsection by notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other documents, and such particulars and information as the Collector may require,

subsection.continued: are provided by the borrower to the Collector at any time after the stock borrowing and lending agreement is executed but before the expiry of 30 days after the stock borrowing is effected. (Replaced L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: A borrower who has effected any stock borrowings under a stock borrowing and lending agreement, an executed copy of which has been provided to the Collector in accordance with subsection (12A), shall— (Amended 33 of 1998 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep a book in such form;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: furnish to the Collector a return—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in such form;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: containing such particulars in respect of such book; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at such times,

subsection.continued: as the Collector may require. (Added 67 of 1989 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: A borrower who, with intent to defraud the Government of any stamp duty , causes or allows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an entry to be made in a book kept under subsection (13)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any particular to be furnished in a return made to the Collector under subsection (13)(c),

subsection.continued: which he knows or has reasonable grounds for believing to be false or misleading in a material respect commits an offence. (Replaced 70 of 1994 s. 4)

subsection.content: A borrower who fails to comply with the requirements of subsection (13) shall incur a penalty at level 2 which shall be recoverable by the Collector as a civil debt due to the Government. (Replaced 70 of 1994 s. 4. Amended L.N. 338 of 1995; 12 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: allotment (分配), in relation to units under a unit trust scheme, means the issue of such units;
borrowed stock (被借用證券), in relation to a stock borrowing, means any Hong Kong stock obtained by a borrower under such stock borrowing; (Replaced 70 of 1994 s. 4)
borrower (借用人), means a person who is eligible to obtain Hong Kong stock under a stock borrowing and lending agreement; (Added 70 of 1994 s. 4. Amended 33 of 1998 s. 6)
lender (借出人) means a person who is eligible to lend Hong Kong stock under a stock borrowing and lending agreement; (Added 70 of 1994 s. 4. Amended 33 of 1998 s. 6)

market contract (市場合約) means a market contract within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Added 68 of 1992 s. 20. Amended 62 of 1995 s. 12; 5 of 2002 s. 407)

previous closing price (先前收市價格), in relation to Hong Kong stock, means the previous closing price of such Hong Kong stock as determined in accordance with the rules and practices of the recognized exchange company that operates the relevant stock market; (Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

reasonable equivalent (合理對等項目), in relation to any stock obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in paragraph (a)(i)(A) or (b)(i)(A) of the definition of stock borrowing and lending agreement, means any stock or monies which, in the opinion of the Collector, can, as a result of the occurrence of a relevant event, be reasonably and fairly be regarded as the equivalent of the stock so obtained; (Added L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

recognized clearing house (認可結算所) means a recognized clearing house within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Replaced 68 of 1992 s. 20. Amended 62 of 1995 s. 12; 5 of 2002 s. 407)

def.name: RelevantEvent
def.leadIn: relevant event (有關事件), in relation to any stock obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in paragraph (a)(i)(A) or (b)(i)(A) of the definition of stock borrowing and lending agreement, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exercise of any of the powers conferred by section 53(1)(a) to (d) of the relevant Ordinance; (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the exercise of any of the powers conferred by section 170(2)(a) to (e) and 174(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other event,

def.continued: which, in the opinion of the Collector, makes any requirement to return stock of the same quantity and description as the stock so obtained either impracticable or inappropriate; (Added L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

subsection.def: rules (規章), in relation to a recognized clearing house and a recognized exchange company, has the same meaning as it has in relation to those bodies in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

sale or purchase (售賣或購買) includes any disposal or acquisition (other than an allotment) for valuable consideration, and exchange, and any transaction in respect of which an instrument is deemed by virtue of section 30(3), (4) or (5) to be a transfer by way of sale, and any reference to sale (售賣) or purchase (購買) shall be construed accordingly;

def.name: SpecifiedDay
def.leadIn: specified day (指明日期), in relation to a stock borrowing, means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where subsection (12)(b) applies, the day on which the borrowed stock referred to in that subsection was obtained under the stock borrowing and lending agreement to which the stock borrowing relates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where subsection (12)(c) applies, the day on which the borrower fails to comply with any demand as described in that subsection; (Replaced L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

subsection.def: specified payment (指明付款), in relation to any stock, means a payment of an amount equivalent to the amount of any dividend, interest and other distribution payable in respect of the stock or its reasonable equivalent or both by the issuer of the stock or its reasonable equivalent or by any other person to the holder of the stock or its reasonable equivalent during the period after the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in paragraph (a)(i)(A) or (b)(i)(A) of the definition of stock borrowing and lending agreement and before a return or delivery is required to be made in accordance with the provisions referred to in paragraph (a)(i)(B) or (b)(i)(B) of that definition; (Added L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

def.name: SpecifiedPurpose
def.leadIn: specified purpose (指明用途), in relation to the borrowing of stock by any person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the settling of a sale of Hong Kong stock wherever effected, whether by the person himself or another person;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the replacement, in whole or in part, of Hong Kong stock obtained by the person under another stock borrowing;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the on-lending of the stock borrowed to another person who effects a stock borrowing in respect of such stock on-lent; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other purpose as the Collector may, in writing, allow either generally or in any particular case; (Added 70 of 1994 s. 4. Amended 33 of 1998 s. 6)

def.name: StockBorrowing
def.leadIn: stock borrowing (證券借用) means the obtaining by a borrower from a lender, under a stock borrowing and lending agreement, of Hong Kong stock the sale and purchase of which in Hong Kong are subject to the rules and practices of the recognized exchange company that operates the relevant stock market, whether the Hong Kong stock is so obtained— (Amended L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17; 5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: directly from the lender; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: indirectly under or through a recognized clearing house and in accordance with the rules of that recognized clearing house which constitute the stock borrowing and lending agreement; (Replaced 70 of 1994 s. 4. Amended 33 of 1998 s. 6)

def.name: StockBorrowingAndLendingAgreement
def.leadIn: stock borrowing and lending agreement (證券借用及借出協議) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an agreement which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: contains—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: provisions providing for the obtaining of any stock by a person from any other person;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: provisions requiring—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: the return of stock of the same quantity and description as the stock obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in sub-subparagraph (A); or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: the delivery of the reasonable equivalent of the stock so obtained; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.leadIn: provisions which—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: require a specified payment to be made by the person by whom the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in sub-subparagraph (A) to the person from whom the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: provide for an arrangement which, in the opinion of the Collector, can be regarded as a fair and proper alternative to the requirement to make the specified payment; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not, in the opinion of the Collector, have the effect of reducing the risk of loss or opportunity for gain, in respect of the stock, of the person from whom the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in subparagraph (i)(A); or (Replaced L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the rules of a recognized clearing house which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: contain the following provisions approved by the Collector—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.leadIn: provisions requiring—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: the return of stock of the same quantity and description as the stock obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in sub-subparagraph (A); or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: the delivery of the reasonable equivalent of the stock so obtained; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.leadIn: provisions which—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: require a specified payment to be made by the participant by whom the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in sub-subparagraph (A) to the participant from whom the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions; or

subparagraph.name: II
ii
subparagraph.content: do not, in the opinion of the Collector, have the effect of reducing the risk of loss or opportunity for gain, in respect of the stock, of the person from whom the stock is obtained pursuant to the provisions referred to in subparagraph (i)(A); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: are subscribed to by participants of the clearing system of the recognized clearing house as a precondition for their obtaining of any stock within the meaning of subparagraph (i)(A); (Replaced L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

def.name: StockReturn
def.leadIn: stock return (證券交還), in relation to a stock borrowing, means a transaction by which a borrower, in accordance with the stock borrowing and lending agreement to which the stock borrowing relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: returns any stock which is of the same description as the borrowed stock (other than that which is the subject of a sale and purchase referred to in subsection (12)); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivers any reasonable equivalent of the borrowed stock (other than that which is the subject of a sale and purchase referred to in subsection (12)),

def.continued: whether or not the return or delivery is made— (Amended L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 17)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: directly to the lender; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: indirectly under or through a recognized clearing house and in accordance with the rules of that recognized clearing house which constitute the stock borrowing and lending agreement; (Replaced 70 of 1994 s. 4. Amended 33 of 1998 s. 6)

subsection.def: transaction (交易), in relation to a stock return, includes the return by a borrower to a lender of a lesser quantity of stock than that obtained by him on the day that the borrowed stock was so obtained. (Added 70 of 1994 s. 4)

section.name: s19A
section.heading: Refund of stamp duty in respect of sale and purchase of units under unit trust schemes

subsection.leadIn: Where stamp duty is paid under head 2(1) in the First Schedule in respect of a sale or purchase of a unit under a unit trust scheme effected by the managers under such scheme, the stamp duty shall be refunded to the managers upon application to the Collector under subsection (2) if the managers and trustees under such scheme, before the expiration of 2 months from the date on which the sale or purchase is effected, jointly certify that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate, if any, in respect of the unit has been cancelled;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as a consequence of the sale or purchase, a proportionate part of the trust property has been realized, and the trust property diminished accordingly; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the unit is extinguished and the managers have no power to transfer any other unit in lieu thereof.

subsection.content: On an application for a refund of stamp duty under this section, the applicant shall produce to the Collector the contract notes in respect of which the stamp duty was paid or, where applicable, the stamp certificates issued in respect of the contract notes, and the joint certificate of the managers and trustees referred to in subsection (1). (Amended 21 of 2003 s. 12)

subsection.def: In this section trust property (信託財產) has the meaning assigned to it by section 30.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Passing on of dividends or interest on Hong Kong stock prohibited

subsection.leadIn: No person shall be entitled to claim, directly or indirectly, the payment of any dividend or interest or of the amount or value of any dividend or interest on any Hong Kong stock unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such person is the registered owner of the Hong Kong stock at the time of such claim;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such person was the registered owner of the Hong Kong stock at some time subsequent to the date on which the dividend was declared or the interest became due;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such person is entitled to be paid such dividend or interest under a declaration of trust in favour of a specified person or otherwise as a beneficiary under a trust; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such person has lent money on the security of the Hong Kong stock and is entitled by the terms of the loan to claim such dividend or interest.

subsection.content: No person shall demand or request or accept, directly or indirectly, payment of any dividend or interest or of the amount or value of any dividend or interest which under subsection (1) he is not entitled to claim.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall, directly or indirectly, pay any dividend or interest or the amount or value of any dividend or interest on any Hong Kong stock to any other person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such other person is the registered owner of the Hong Kong stock;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other person was the registered owner of the Hong Kong stock at some time subsequent to the date on which the dividend was declared or the interest became due;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other person is entitled to be paid such dividend or interest under a declaration of trust in favour of a specified person or otherwise as a beneficiary under a trust; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such other person has lent money on the security of the Hong Kong stock and is entitled by the terms of the loan to claim such dividend or interest.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in this section, this section shall not apply to specified payment as defined in section 19(16). (Added L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 18)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Stamp duty chargeable where consideration in respect of immovable property consists of stock or security other than stock

subsection.content: Where the consideration or any part of the consideration for a conveyance on sale consists of any stock, the conveyance shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to the value of the stock on the date of the conveyance.

Where the consideration or any part of the consideration for a conveyance on sale consists of any security not being stock, the conveyance shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to the amount due on the date of the conveyance for principal and interest upon the security.

section.name: s23
section.heading: How consideration consisting of periodical payments to be charged

subsection.content: In the case of a conveyance on sale or a sale or purchase of Hong Kong stock, where the consideration or any part of the consideration consists of money payable periodically for a definite period not exceeding 20 years so that the total amount to be paid can be previously ascertained, the conveyance or contract note shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to a consideration of such total amount.

In the case of a conveyance on sale or a sale or purchase of Hong Kong stock, where the consideration or any part of the consideration consists of money payable for a definite period exceeding 20 years or in perpetuity or for any indefinite period not terminable with life, the conveyance or contract note shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to a consideration of an amount equal to the total amount which will or may, according to the terms of sale, be payable during the period of 20 years after the date of the conveyance or contract note.

In the case of a conveyance on sale or a sale or purchase of Hong Kong stock, where the consideration or any part of the consideration consists of money payable periodically for a life or lives, the conveyance or contract note shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to a consideration equal to the amount which will or may, according to the terms of sale, be payable during the period of 12 years after the date of the conveyance or contract note.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Stamp duty chargeable where conveyance etc. is in consideration of debt etc.

subsection.content: In the case of a conveyance on sale or any transaction whereby a beneficial interest in Hong Kong stock passes, where the conveyance or transaction is in consideration, wholly or in part, of any debt due to the transferee or is subject either certainly or contingently to the payment or transfer of any money or stock, whether or not being or constituting a charge or incumbrance upon the property or interest so conveyed or passing, the debt, money or stock is to be deemed the whole or part, as the case may be, of the consideration by reference to which the conveyance or contract note is chargeable with stamp duty.

Where a conveyance on sale or transaction whereby a beneficial interest in any Hong Kong stock passes is in consideration wholly or in part of any debt due to the transferee and, apart from this subsection, the consideration by reference to which the conveyance or contract note would be chargeable with stamp duty would exceed the value of the property conveyed or beneficial interest passing, that consideration shall be treated as reduced to that value; and the conveyance or contract note shall not be duly stamped unless it is stamped under section 13(3).

Where, by virtue of or in connection with any transaction referred to in subsection (1) whereby a beneficial interest in any shares in a body corporate passes, any liability is incurred by the transferee in respect of any indebtedness of the body corporate, the transaction shall, in addition to any other payment of money or transfer of shares to which it is subject, be deemed to be subject to the payment of an amount of money equal to the amount of such indebtedness.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Stamp duty chargeable in case of certain conveyances

subsection.content: Where immovable property contracted to be sold for one consideration for the whole is conveyed to the purchaser in separate parts or parcels by different instruments, the consideration shall be apportioned in such manner as the parties think fit, so that a distinct consideration for each separate part or parcel is set forth in the conveyance relating thereto, and such conveyance shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to such distinct consideration.

Where immovable property contracted to be purchased for one consideration for the whole by 2 or more persons jointly, or by any person for himself and others or wholly for others, is conveyed in parts or parcels by separate instruments to the persons by or for whom the same was purchased for distinct parts of the consideration, the conveyance of each separate part or parcel shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to the distinct part of the consideration therein specified.

Where there are several instruments of conveyance for completing the purchaser’s title to immovable property sold, the principal instrument of conveyance only shall be chargeable with stamp duty and the other instruments shall not be chargeable with stamp duty.

Where a person having contracted for the purchase of any immovable property but not having obtained a conveyance thereof contracts to sell the same to any other person and the property is in consequence conveyed immediately to the sub-purchaser, the conveyance shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference to the consideration moving from the sub-purchaser.

Where a person having contracted for the purchase of any immovable property but not having obtained a conveyance contracts to sell the whole or any part or parts thereof to any other person or persons and the property is in consequence conveyed by the original seller to different persons in parts or parcels, the conveyance of each part or parcel shall be chargeable with stamp duty by reference only to the consideration moving from the sub-purchaser thereof, without regard to the amount or value of the original consideration.

Where a sub-purchaser takes an actual conveyance of the interest of the person immediately selling to him, which is chargeable with stamp duty by reference to the consideration moving from him and is duly stamped accordingly, any conveyance to be afterwards made to him of the same immovable property by the original seller shall not be chargeable with stamp duty.

Where upon the exchange of any immovable property for any other immovable property, or upon the partition of any immovable property, any consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, for equality, the principal or only instrument whereby the exchange or partition is effected shall, subject to sections 27, 29AO and 29AP, be charged with the same stamp duty as a conveyance on sale for the consideration, and with that stamp duty only; and where in any such case there are several instruments for completing the title of either party, the instruments other than the principal instrument shall not be chargeable with any stamp duty. (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 5)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Voluntary dispositions

subsection.content: Any conveyance of immovable property operating as a voluntary disposition inter vivos shall be chargeable with stamp duty as a conveyance on sale, with the substitution of the value of the property conveyed for the amount or value of the consideration for the sale.

In the case of an instrument of transfer operating as a voluntary disposition inter vivos of Hong Kong stock, or an instrument referred to in section 28(1) which so operates by virtue of that section, any stamp duty paid in respect of contract notes made under section 19(1) in respect of the amount or value of any consideration given by the transferee for such Hong Kong stock shall be set off against the stamp duty chargeable on such instrument of transfer.
A conveyance or transfer operating as a voluntary disposition inter vivos shall not be duly stamped unless the Collector has stamped the instrument of conveyance or transfer under section 13(3)(b).

Any conveyance or transfer (not being a disposition made in favour of a purchaser or incumbrancer or other person in good faith and for valuable consideration) shall for the purposes of this Ordinance be deemed to be a conveyance or transfer operating as a voluntary disposition inter vivos, and (except where marriage is the consideration) the consideration for any conveyance or transfer shall not for this purpose be deemed to be valuable consideration where the Collector is of opinion that by reason of the inadequacy of the sum paid as consideration or other circumstances the conveyance or transfer confers a substantial benefit on the person to whom the property is conveyed or transferred.

Nothing in this section shall apply to a conveyance or transfer made for nominal consideration for the purpose of securing the repayment of an advance or loan or made for effectuating the appointment of a new trustee, whether the trust is expressed or implied, or under which no beneficial interest passes in the property conveyed or transferred, or made to a beneficiary by a trustee or other person in a fiduciary capacity under any trust, whether expressed or implied, and this subsection shall have effect only if the circumstances exempting the conveyance or transfer from charge under this section are set forth in the conveyance or transfer. (Amended 33 of 1998 s. 7)

subsection.def: In this section conveyance (轉易契) includes any agreement for a lease or any release or renunciation of immovable property.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Stamp duty chargeable in case of conveyance or transfer in contemplation of sale or subject to power of revocation etc.

subsection.content: Subject to this section, any instrument whereby property is conveyed or transferred to any person in contemplation of a sale of that property shall be treated as a conveyance or transfer operating as a voluntary disposition inter vivos of that property.

subsection.leadIn: If on a claim made to the Collector not later than 2 years after the making or execution of an instrument to which subsection (1) applies, it is shown to his satisfaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the sale in contemplation of which the instrument was made or executed has not taken place and the property has been re-conveyed or re-transferred to the person from whom it was conveyed or transferred or to a person to whom his rights have been transmitted on death or bankruptcy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the sale has taken place for a consideration which is less than the value by reference to which stamp duty was paid in respect of the instrument by virtue of this section,

subsection.continued: the Collector shall repay the stamp duty paid by virtue of this section, in a case falling under paragraph (a), so far as it exceeds the stamp duty which would have been payable apart from this section and, in a case falling under paragraph (b), so far as it exceeds the stamp duty which would have been payable if the instrument had been stamped in accordance with subsection (1) in respect of a value equal to the consideration in question:
subsection.proviso: Provided that, in a case falling under the said paragraph (b), stamp duty shall not be repayable if it appears to the Collector that the circumstances are such that a conveyance or transfer on the sale in question would have been chargeable with stamp duty by virtue of section 27(4).

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) shall apply whether or not an instrument conveys or transfers other property in addition to the property in contemplation of the sale of which it is made or executed, but those subsections shall not affect the stamp duty chargeable in respect of that other property.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 27 and this section, the value of property conveyed or transferred by an instrument chargeable with stamp duty in accordance with either of those provisions shall be determined without regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any power (whether or not contained in the instrument) on the exercise of which the property, or any part of or any interest in the property, may be re-vested in the person from whom it was conveyed or transferred or in any person on his behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any annuity reserved out of the property or any part of it, or any life or other interest so reserved, being an interest which is subject to forfeiture,

subsection.continued: but if on a claim made to the Collector not later than 2 years after the making or execution of the instrument it is shown to his satisfaction that any such power as is mentioned in paragraph (a) has been exercised in relation to the property and the property or any property representing it has been re-conveyed or re-transferred in whole or in part in consequence of that exercise the Collector shall repay the stamp duty paid by virtue of this subsection, in a case where the whole of such property has been so re-conveyed or re-transferred, so far as it exceeds the stamp duty which would have been payable apart from this subsection and, in any other case, so far as it exceeds the stamp duty which would have been payable if the instrument had operated to convey or transfer only such property as is not so re-conveyed or re-transferred.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Certificate with respect to certain conveyances on sale

subsection.content: References in head 1(1) in the First Schedule to a conveyance on sale being certified at a particular amount mean that such conveyance on sale contains a statement certifying that the transaction effected by the instrument does not form part of a larger transaction or series of transactions in respect of which the amount or value, or aggregate amount or value, of the consideration exceeds that amount.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1) a reference to the amount or value of the consideration shall be construed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to stamp duty chargeable on a conveyance operating as a voluntary disposition inter vivos, as a reference to the value of the property conveyed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to stamp duty chargeable on a lease or agreement for a lease, as a reference to the amount or value of the consideration in money, stock or security, other than rent.

part.name: P3A
part.heading: Certain Instruments Dealing with Immovable Property

section.name: s29A
section.heading: Interpretation and application of Part IIIA

subsection.leadIn: In this Part and the First Schedule—

def.name: AgreementForSale
def.leadIn: agreement for sale (買賣協議) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an instrument in which a person contracts to sell or purchase immovable property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an instrument in which a person confers, or has conferred on him, an option or a right to purchase immovable property or a right of pre-emption in respect of immovable property, other than a specified option or right;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument, other than a mortgage or charge made in favour of a financial institution within the meaning of section 2 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112), in which a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: gives or is given a power of attorney expressed to be irrevocable and given to secure a proprietary interest of the donee of the power or the performance of an obligation owed to the donee, and giving the donee authority on behalf of the donor to sell or otherwise dispose of any interest of the donor in immovable property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: grants or is granted an authority on behalf of the grantor to sell or otherwise dispose of any interest of the grantor in immovable property, and under which consideration for that authority moves from the grantee of the authority to the grantor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an instrument in which a declaration of trust in respect of immovable property is made, other than a declaration of trust under which no beneficial interest passes in the property subject to the declaration;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an instrument which, if implemented, would be implemented by a conveyance on sale;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an instrument which constitutes a memorandum, note, or other evidence of an unwritten sale agreement;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.leadIn: except as provided in section 29AB, an instrument in which a purchaser under an instrument referred to in this definition makes a nomination or gives a direction that— (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 9)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: transfers, or gives a power to transfer, any benefit, in respect of immovable property, of the purchaser under the second-mentioned instrument; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: authorizes another person to take a conveyance of immovable property that is subject to the second-mentioned instrument or to execute such a conveyance in favour of a third party; (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 9)

subsection.def: authorized person (認可人士) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); (Added 18 of 2018 s. 3)
Building Authority (建築事務監督) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); (Added 18 of 2018 s. 3)
building plan (建築圖則) means a plan that is approved by the Building Authority for the purposes of section 14(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); (Added 18 of 2018 s. 3)
chargeable agreement for sale (可予徵收印花稅的買賣協議) means an agreement for sale chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1A) in the First Schedule;

def.name: HongKongPermanentResident
def.leadIn: Hong Kong permanent resident (香港永久性居民) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who holds a valid permanent identity card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who does not hold a valid permanent identity card but—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is, under regulation 25(e) of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), not required to register or apply for the issue of an identity card or for the renewal of an identity card under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177) and those Regulations; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is entitled to be issued with a permanent identity card if he or she makes an application to the registration officer as defined by section 1A(1) of that Ordinance for that purpose; (Added 2 of 2014 s. 6)

subsection.def: mentally incapacitated person (精神上無行為能力的人) means a person who is mentally disordered or mentally handicapped within the meaning of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) and is, because of his or her mental state, incapable of managing and administering his or her property and affairs; (Added 2 of 2014 s. 6)

def.name: NonresidentialProperty
def.leadIn: non-residential property (非住宅物業) means immovable property which, under the existing conditions of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344); (Amended 27 of 1993 s. 45)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occupation permit issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other instrument which the Collector is satisfied effectively restricts the permitted user of the property,

def.continued: may not be used, at any time during the term of the Government lease in respect of the property or during the term of the Government lease that has been agreed for in respect of the property (as is appropriate), wholly or partly for residential purposes; (Amended 12 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.def: permanent identity card (永久性居民身分證) has the meaning given by section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); (Added 2 of 2014 s. 6)

def.name: Purchaser
def.leadIn: purchaser (購買人) includes any person who, under an agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement,—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contracts to purchase immovable property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: acquires—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immovable property;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: a power or authority to sell or otherwise dispose of any interest in immovable property;

subparagraph.name: iv
v
subparagraph.content: a power to transfer any such right or benefit;

subparagraph.name: vi

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is named as a person in whose favour another person is authorized to execute a conveyance of immovable property;

subsection.def: residential property (住宅物業) means immovable property other than non-residential property;

def.name: SingleResidentialProperty
def.leadIn: single residential property (單一住宅物業) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a unit and a roof situated in the same building;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a unit and an adjacent flat roof situated in the same building;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a unit and an adjacent garden; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a unit that became a single unit following the demolition of the walls or the floor, or any part of the walls or the floor, separating two units as shown by—

subparagraph.content: a building plan and a letter issued by the Building Authority acknowledging receipt of a certificate of completion of the building works relating to the demolition as required under the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A); or
a plan signed by an authorized person after the completion of the building works relating to the demolition; (Added 18 of 2018 s. 3)

def.name: SpecifiedOptionOrRight
def.leadIn: specified option or right (指明的選擇權或權利) means an option or right to purchase, or a right of pre-emption, conferred—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a lessor on a lessee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a lease, or an agreement for a lease, for a fixed term of not less than 3 years; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in respect of the property subject to the lease,

subsection.def: transferee (承讓人), in relation to a conveyance on sale (except as provided in section 29AO(5)(b) or 29DC(1)(b) and (2)(b)), means the person to whom the property concerned is transferred, or in whom the property is vested, under the conveyance; (Added 14 of 2014 s. 9)

transferor (轉讓人), in relation to a conveyance on sale (except as provided in section 29AO(5)(a) or 29DC(1)(b) and (2)(b)), means the person from whom the property concerned is transferred or divested under the conveyance; (Added 14 of 2014 s. 9)

def.name: Vendor
def.leadIn: vendor (售賣人) includes any person who, under an agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contracts to sell immovable property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: grants, confers, or transfers—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immovable property;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: a power or authority to sell or otherwise dispose of any interest in immovable property;

subparagraph.name: iv
v
subparagraph.content: a power to transfer any such right or benefit;

subparagraph.name: vi

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorizes another person to execute in favour of a third party a conveyance of immovable property that is subject to an agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Collector may determine whether a residential property is a single residential property and, in making such determination, may have regard to any of the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: any other document that the Collector considers relevant. (Added 18 of 2018 s. 3)

subsection.content: An agreement for sale and an unwritten sale agreement may be enforceable or unenforceable, absolute or conditional, formal or informal, temporary or permanent, provisional or non-provisional.
An agreement for sale may consist of 2 or more instruments.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part and head 1(1A), (1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule, and subject to Note 5 to head 1(1A) in that Schedule, an agreement for sale, an unwritten sale agreement or a conveyance on sale is made between the same parties as a previous agreement if, but only if— (Amended 14 of 2011 s. 6; 2 of 2014 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names of both of the vendor and the purchaser or, where there is more than one vendor or more than one purchaser or more than one vendor and more than one purchaser, all of them specified as such in the previous agreement are the same as those in the agreement for sale, the unwritten sale agreement or the conveyance on sale, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is more than one purchaser specified as such in the previous agreement, the property or interest to be acquired by a person as one of the purchasers under the previous agreement is the same as that to be acquired by that person under the agreement for sale, the unwritten sale agreement or the conveyance on sale, as the case may be. (Added 33 of 1998 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, an agreement for sale, an unwritten sale agreement or a conveyance on sale is made on the same terms as a previous agreement if, but only if, the agreement for sale, the unwritten sale agreement or the conveyance on sale (as the case may be) and the previous agreement— (Amended 14 of 2011 s. 6; 2 of 2014 s. 6; L.N. 231 of 2020 and 2 of 2021 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are made in respect of the same immovable property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the same consideration for the conveyance on sale.

subsection.content: Head 1(1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule does not apply to an agreement for sale in respect of non-residential property. (Amended 14 of 2011 s. 6; 2 of 2014 s. 6; 14 of 2014 s. 9)
This Part and head 1(1A), (1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule apply notwithstanding any provision in any other Part of this Ordinance. (Amended 14 of 2011 s. 6; 2 of 2014 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: This Part and head 1(1A) in the First Schedule do not apply to an agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made before; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that supersedes an agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement made between the same parties and on the same terms before,

subsection.continued: the commencement of the Stamp Duty (Amendment) Ordinance 1992 (8 of 1992).

section.name: s29AB
section.heading: Nominations or directions that are not agreements for sale

def.name: AgreementForSale
def.leadIn: A nomination or direction is excluded from paragraph (h) of the definition of agreement for sale in section 29A(1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made or given in favour of a person who is to be a trustee for the purchaser mentioned in paragraph (h) of that definition in respect of the property concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as it relates to head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the property is residential property; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) applies to the nomination or direction; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as it relates to head 1(1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the property is residential property; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subsection (3) applies to the nomination or direction.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the nomination or direction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made or given in favour of one, or more than one, person (whether or not also in favour of the purchaser); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the date of the nomination or direction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that person, or each of those persons, is closely related to the purchaser, or to each of the purchasers;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is more than one person, those persons are also closely related;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that person, or each of those persons, is acting on his or her own behalf; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: that person, or each of those persons, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the nomination or direction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made or given in favour of one, or more than one, person (whether or not also in favour of the purchaser);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person, or each of those persons, is closely related to the purchaser, or to each of the purchasers; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where there is more than one person, those persons are also closely related.

section.name: s29AC
section.heading: Meaning of beneficial owner of residential property

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part and head 1 in the First Schedule—

def.name: BeneficialOwner
def.leadIn: beneficial owner (實益擁有人), in relation to a residential property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes a purchaser under an agreement for sale of the property that is subsisting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: excludes a vendor under an agreement for sale of the property that is subsisting.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), an agreement for sale of a residential property is subsisting if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement provides for the conveyance of the property but the conveyance is not yet executed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the agreement is not one that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cancelled, annulled or rescinded; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: otherwise not performed.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part and head 1 in the First Schedule, a reference to a beneficial owner of a residential property includes a beneficial owner of part of the property.

section.name: s29AD
section.heading: Meaning of closely related persons
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part and head 1 in the First Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 persons are closely related if one of them is the parent, spouse, child, brother or sister of the other; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3 or more persons are closely related if each of them is a parent, spouse, child, brother or sister of each of the others.

section.name: s29AE
section.heading: Dates of acquisition and disposal of immovable property: general provisions

subsection.leadIn: For determining the stamp duty payable on an instrument under this Part (except sections 29CA and 29DA) and head 1 (except sub-heads (1AA) and (1B)) in the First Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date a person acquires or disposes of immovable property is determined according to this section and sections 29AF and 29AG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person acquires 2 or more immovable properties on the same date, a reference to the date of acquisition by the person of one of those properties is a reference to the particular time at which that property is acquired by the person on that date;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a person disposes of 2 or more immovable properties on the same date, a reference to the date of disposal by the person of one of those properties is a reference to the particular time at which that property is disposed of by the person on that date;

def.name: SubjectProperty,OriginalProperty
def.leadIn: if a person acquires an immovable property (subject property) and disposes of another immovable property (original property) on the same date—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a reference to the date of acquisition by the person of the subject property is a reference to the particular time at which that property is acquired by the person on that date; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a reference to the date of disposal by the person of the original property is a reference to the particular time at which that property is disposed of by the person on that date; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to the date of an instrument—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a reference to the date the instrument is executed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for paragraphs (b), (c) and (d), is a reference to the particular time at which the instrument is executed on that date.

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by a person of immovable property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to sections 29AF and 29AG—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if there is an agreement for sale that provides for the conveyance of the property to the person—the date of the agreement;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if more than one such agreement is made between the same parties and on the same terms in respect of the property—the date of the first of those agreements; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the conveyance under which the property is transferred to or vested in the person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the conveyance consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of disposal by a person of immovable property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to sections 29AF and 29AG—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if there is an agreement for sale that provides for the conveyance of the property from the person—the date of the agreement;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if more than one such agreement is made between the same parties and on the same terms in respect of the property—the date of the first of those agreements; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the conveyance under which the property is transferred or divested from the person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the conveyance consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

section.name: s29AF
section.heading: Dates of acquisition and disposal of immovable property: conveyance on sale executed in pursuance of agreement for sale

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply if a conveyance on sale of immovable property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is executed in pursuance of an agreement for sale; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is in favour of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: a purchaser under the agreement (original purchaser); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.def: another person who is not an original purchaser (additional transferee).

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by the original purchaser of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the agreement for sale mentioned in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of disposal by the original purchaser of the proportion of the property to be transferred to or vested in the additional transferee is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the conveyance on sale mentioned in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the conveyance consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by the additional transferee of that transferee’s proportion of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the conveyance on sale mentioned in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the conveyance consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (6), (7) and (8) apply if a conveyance on sale of immovable property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is executed in pursuance of an agreement for sale; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: is in favour of one or some (but not all) of the purchasers under the agreement (original purchasers).

subsection.leadIn: For subsections (7) and (8), a person is a withdrawn purchaser if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is one of the original purchasers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conveyance concerned is not executed in favour of the person.

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by a withdrawn purchaser of that purchaser’s proportion of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the agreement for sale mentioned in subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of disposal by a withdrawn purchaser of that purchaser’s proportion of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the conveyance on sale mentioned in subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the conveyance consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

section.name: s29AG
section.heading: Dates of acquisition and disposal of immovable property: more than one agreement for sale involving same immovable property

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: an agreement for sale (original agreement) is made in respect of immovable property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: another agreement for sale (second agreement) is made in respect of the whole or part of the property (whether by the vendor or purchaser or both under the original agreement) before a conveyance on sale of the property or that part of the property is executed in pursuance of the original agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: under the second agreement, the purchasers are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: a purchaser under the original agreement (original purchaser); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.def: another person who is not an original purchaser (additional purchaser).

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by the original purchaser of the property, or that part of the property, is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the original agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of disposal by the original purchaser of the proportion of the property to be transferred to or vested in the additional purchaser is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the second agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by the additional purchaser of that purchaser’s proportion of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the second agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (6), (7) and (8) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: an agreement for sale (original agreement) is made in respect of immovable property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: another agreement for sale (second agreement) is made in respect of the whole or part of the property (whether by the vendor or purchaser or both under the original agreement) before a conveyance on sale of the property or that part of the property is executed in pursuance of the original agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.def: one or some (but not all) of the purchasers under the original agreement (original purchasers) is or are the purchaser or purchasers under the second agreement.

subsection.leadIn: For subsections (7) and (8), a person is a withdrawn purchaser if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is one of the original purchasers; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a purchaser under the second agreement.

subsection.leadIn: The date of acquisition by a withdrawn purchaser of that purchaser’s proportion of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the original agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

subsection.leadIn: The date of disposal by a withdrawn purchaser of that purchaser’s proportion of the property is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the second agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that agreement consists of 2 or more instruments—the date of the first of those instruments.

section.name: s29AH
section.heading: Instruments involving minors or mentally incapacitated persons
section.leadIn: For determining the stamp duty payable on an instrument under this Part (except sections 29CA, 29CB, 29DA and 29DB) and head 1 (except sub-heads (1AA), (1AAB), (1B) and (1C)) in the First Schedule, if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a party to the instrument is acting in the transaction as a trustee or guardian for another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other person is a Hong Kong permanent resident who is a minor or mentally incapacitated person,

section.continued: the Collector must treat the other person as a party to the instrument in place of the trustee or guardian.

section.name: s29AI
section.heading: Scales of rates applicable to conveyances on sale chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty
section.leadIn: Except as provided in sections 29AIA, 29AJ, 29AK, 29AL, 29AM, 29AN, 29AO, 29AP, 29AQ, 29AR and 29AS and Notes 1B and 1C to head 1(1) in the First Schedule, a conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the property concerned is residential property, under Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the property concerned is non-residential property, under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule. (Amended L.N. 231 of 2020 and 2 of 2021 s. 5)

section.name: s29AIA
section.heading: Scales of rates applicable to instruments effecting exchange between residential property and non-residential property

subsection.leadIn: An instrument falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument effects the exchange of a residential property for a non-residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration is paid or given for equality.

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in section 29AO, an instrument that falls within subsection (1) is chargeable with stamp duty as a conveyance on sale by reference to the consideration mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the consideration is paid or given by the person to whom the residential property is transferred, under Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the consideration is paid or given by the person to whom the non-residential property is transferred, under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule. (Amended L.N. 231 of 2020 and 2 of 2021 s. 6)

section.name: s29AJ
section.heading: Certain conveyances on sale of residential property to Hong Kong permanent residents chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is a single residential property; and (Amended 18 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) or (3) applies to the conveyance.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the conveyance if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the conveyance is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that transferee, or each of those transferees, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the conveyance if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the transferees under the conveyance consist of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is a Hong Kong permanent resident; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is not a Hong Kong permanent resident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those transferees are closely related;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: each of them is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

section.name: s29AK
section.heading: Certain conveyances on sale of residential property together with car parking space to Hong Kong permanent residents chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the properties concerned are a single residential property and a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle; and (Amended 18 of 2018 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) applies to the conveyance.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the conveyance if, on the date of acquisition of the properties—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the conveyance is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that transferee, or each of those transferees, is neither a beneficial owner of any other residential property, nor a beneficial owner of any other car parking space, in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a), a car parking space is permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle unless any of the following provides that the parking space may be used, at any time during the term of the Government lease in respect of the parking space or during the term of the Government lease that has been agreed for in respect of the parking space (as is appropriate), for the parking of more than 1 motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occupation permit issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other instrument which the Collector is satisfied effectively restricts the permitted user of the parking space.

section.name: s29AL
section.heading: Certain conveyances on sale of residential property between closely related persons chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) applies to the conveyance.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the conveyance if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the conveyance is closely related to the transferor, or to each of the transferors, under the conveyance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is more than one transferee under the conveyance, the transferees are also closely related; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that transferee, or each of those transferees, is acting on his or her own behalf.

subsection.content: For the purpose of subsection (2)(a), if a transferor is acting in the transaction as a trustee for another person, that other person is treated as the transferor in place of the trustee.

section.name: s29AM
section.heading: Conveyances on sale of property for replacing other property disposed of under certain Ordinances chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee under the conveyance is acting on the transferee’s own behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: the property concerned (replacement property) is acquired by the transferee to replace another property (original property);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the original property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was owned by the transferee alone or jointly with any other person or persons; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: falls within subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subsection (3) applies to the replacement property.

subsection.leadIn: The original property falls within this subsection if it has been—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purchased or otherwise acquired by the Urban Renewal Authority for the purposes of any of its projects as defined by section 2 of the Urban Renewal Authority Ordinance (Cap. 563);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 3 of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) or purchased by agreement under section 4A of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sold pursuant to an order for sale made by the Lands Tribunal under section 4(1)(b)(i) of the Land (Compulsory Sale for Redevelopment) Ordinance (Cap. 545);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 4(1) of the Mass Transit Railway (Land Resumption and Related Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 276);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 13(1) of the Roads (Works, Use and Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 370);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 16 or 28(1) of the Railways Ordinance (Cap. 519);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: acquired under an acquisition order made under section 3(1) or (2) of the Land Acquisition (Possessory Title) Ordinance (Cap. 130); or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 37(2) of the Land Drainage Ordinance (Cap. 446).

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the replacement property if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of disposal of the original property under subsection (2) is earlier than the date of acquisition by the transferee of the replacement property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the original property and the replacement property are both residential properties, or both non-residential properties.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a conveyance on sale under which a replacement property is acquired by a transferee to replace an original property if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee has acquired another replacement property to replace the original property under another instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stamp duty has been charged on that other instrument according to Scale 2 of head 1(1), or Scale 2 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule because of the operation of subsection (1) or section 29BE(1).

subsection.leadIn: If an original property was owned by more than one person, subsection (1) applies to each owner in relation to 1 replacement property acquired by the owner, regardless of whether or not the replacement property is acquired—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the owner alone; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by the owner jointly with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: another owner of the original property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other person.

section.name: s29AN
section.heading: Other conveyances on sale chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates
section.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conveyance is made pursuant to a decree or order of any court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conveyance is a decree or order of any court by which the property concerned is transferred to or vested in the transferee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: under the conveyance, a mortgaged property is transferred to, or vested in, its mortgagee that is a financial institution within the meaning of section 2 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112), or a receiver appointed by the mortgagee.

section.name: s29AO
section.heading: Certain instruments effecting exchange between residential property and non-residential property chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An instrument falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument effects the exchange of a residential property for a non-residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration is paid or given by the transferee for equality.

subsection.content: An instrument that falls within subsection (1) is chargeable with stamp duty as a conveyance on sale under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration mentioned in subsection (1) if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (3) or (4) applies to the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the instrument if, on the date of the instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the instrument is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that transferee, or each of those transferees, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the instrument if, on the date of the instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the instrument is closely related to the transferor, or to each of the transferors, under the instrument;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is more than one transferee under the instrument, the transferees are also closely related; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that transferee, or each of those transferees, is acting on his or her own behalf.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, if a person transfers a residential property to another person under an instrument that falls within subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former is the transferor under the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the latter is the transferee under the instrument.

section.name: s29AP
section.heading: Certain instruments effecting exchange between residential properties chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An instrument falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument effects the exchange of a residential property for another residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration is paid or given for equality.

subsection.content: An instrument that falls within subsection (1) is chargeable with stamp duty as a conveyance on sale under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration mentioned in subsection (1) if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (3) or (4) applies to the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the instrument if, on the date of the instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each party to the instrument is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of them is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the instrument if, on the date of the instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all parties to the instrument are closely related; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf.

section.name: s29AQ
section.heading: Certain conveyances on sale of residential property involving additional closely related persons chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in section 29D(6)(c)(ii) and (7), this section applies to a conveyance on sale if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conveyance is executed in pursuance of an agreement for sale; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the conveyance is in favour of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: a purchaser under the agreement (original purchaser); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person who falls within subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A person falls within this subsection if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not an original purchaser; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is, on the date of the conveyance, closely related to the original purchaser.

subsection.content: If the agreement for sale is duly stamped, or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the execution of the conveyance on sale), the conveyance is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration for the conveyance, less a fraction of the stamp duty representing the proportion of the property that is vested in the original purchaser under the conveyance.
For the purposes of subsection (3), joint tenants are treated as having equal undivided shares in the property concerned.
If the agreement for sale is not duly stamped, or not stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1), the Collector may refuse to stamp the conveyance.

section.name: s29AR
section.heading: Certain conveyances on sale of residential property involving withdrawal of closely related persons chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in section 29D(6)(c)(ii) and (7), this section applies to a conveyance on sale if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conveyance is executed in pursuance of an agreement for sale;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conveyance is in favour of one or some (but not all) of the purchasers under the agreement; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on the date of the conveyance, the transferee, or each of the transferees, is closely related to the withdrawn purchaser, or to each of the withdrawn purchasers.

subsection.content: If the agreement for sale is duly stamped, or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the execution of the conveyance on sale), the conveyance is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration for the conveyance, less a fraction of the stamp duty representing the proportion of the property that was acquired by the transferee or transferees under the agreement.

For the purposes of subsection (2), an agreement that provides for a conveyance to purchasers as joint tenants is treated as an agreement to convey the property to those purchasers in equal undivided shares.
If the agreement for sale is not duly stamped, or not stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1), the Collector may refuse to stamp the conveyance.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person is a transferee if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person is one of the purchasers under the agreement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conveyance is executed in favour of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person is a withdrawn purchaser if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person is one of the purchasers under the agreement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conveyance is not executed in favour of the person.

section.name: s29AS
section.heading: Certain conveyances on sale of residential property related to Public Rental Housing Flats under Tenants Purchase Scheme to tenants or authorized occupants chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the acquisition of the property is made under the Tenants Purchase Scheme of the Housing Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
