paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) applies to the conveyance.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the conveyance if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the conveyance is a tenant or an authorized occupant of the Housing Authority in respect of the property acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that transferee, or each of those transferees, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

section.name: s29B
section.heading: Duty to execute agreement for sale

subsection.content: Each purchaser and vendor under an unwritten sale agreement or an agreement for sale shall, not later than 30 days after the relevant date, if he has not already done so, execute an agreement for sale containing the matters specified in subsection (5).
Subsection (1) does not apply to a purchaser who, on the relevant date, does not know that the unwritten sale agreement or agreement for sale affects him.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), the relevant date means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an unwritten sale agreement, the date on which that agreement was made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an agreement for sale not preceded by an unwritten sale agreement, or an agreement for sale, made between the same parties and on the same terms, the date on which that agreement was made; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an agreement for sale preceded by one or more than one unwritten sale agreement, or agreement for sale, made between the same parties and on the same terms, the date on which the first of such agreements was made; and

subsection.content: If a person enters into an agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement as agent for a vendor or purchaser, the agent and the vendor or purchaser (as the case may be) are jointly and severally liable to comply with subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The following matters are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the vendor and of the purchaser of the immovable property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the vendor or purchaser is an individual, his identification number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the vendor or purchaser is not an individual but is registered under the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310), the business registration number of the vendor or purchaser;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the description and location of the immovable property;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether the immovable property is residential property or non-residential property, within the meanings of section 29A(1);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the date on which the agreement for sale was made;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if the agreement for sale was preceded by an unwritten sale agreement, or an agreement for sale, made between the same parties and on the same terms, the date on which the first such agreement was made;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not a date has been agreed for a conveyance on sale pursuant to the agreement for sale and, if so, that date;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not there is an agreed consideration for the conveyance on sale that is to, or may, take place pursuant to the agreement for sale and, if so, the amount or value of the consideration;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the amount or value of any other consideration which each person executing the document knows has been paid or given, or has been agreed to be paid or given, to any person for or in connection with the agreement for sale or any conveyance on sale pursuant to that agreement (excluding legal expenses), together with the name, address, and the identification number or business registration number of each person receiving or to receive such consideration, and a description of the benefit to which the consideration relates;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: if the purchaser has not executed the agreement, a statement as to whether or not, to the best of the knowledge of each person executing the agreement, the purchaser knew, at the time the agreement was made, that it affected him.

subsection.content: Any person required to execute an agreement for sale in accordance with subsection (1) who fails to do so is liable civilly to the Collector for the payment of any stamp duty that the person would have been liable to pay under this Ordinance had that agreement (which is deemed for the purposes of this subsection to be a chargeable agreement for sale) been executed and any penalty payable under section 9; and if 2 or more persons fail to execute such an agreement each person is jointly and severally so liable. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 7)

Any person liable, under subsection (6), to pay stamp duty chargeable on an agreement for sale may set off the amount (if any) of that stamp duty paid by him against any stamp duty payable by him in respect of a conveyance on sale made in pursuance of that agreement. (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 13)

No action shall be brought by virtue of subsection (6) for the recovery of any stamp duty with respect to any instrument more than 6 years from the expiration of the time for stamping that instrument.

Any person who with intent to defraud the Government fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence, but the Collector may, before the commencement of criminal proceedings, compound any such offence.
A failure by any person to comply with subsection (1) does not affect the validity or enforceability of an agreement for sale or unwritten sale agreement.

def.name: IdentificationNumber
def.leadIn: In this section, identification number (身分證件號碼) in relation to a person means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of any identity card issued to him under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such card has been issued to him, the number of any travel document, certificate of identity, or document of identity (within the meanings of section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115)) issued to him;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if no such document or certificate has been issued to him, the number of any other document that establishes his identity to the satisfaction of the Collector,

def.continued: but no such number is complete unless the relevant document is described.

section.name: s29BA
section.heading: Scales of rates applicable to agreements for sale chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty
section.leadIn: Except as provided in sections 29BAB, 29BB, 29BC, 29BD, 29BE, 29BF, 29BG, 29BH, 29BI, 29BJ and 29BK and Note 1A to head 1(1A) in the First Schedule, an agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the property concerned is residential property, under Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the property concerned is non-residential property, under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule. (Amended L.N. 231 of 2020 and 2 of 2021 s. 7)

section.name: s29BAB
section.heading: Scales of rates applicable to agreements for exchange between residential property and non-residential property

subsection.leadIn: An agreement falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement provides for the exchange of a residential property for a non-residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, for equality.

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in section 29BG, an agreement that falls within subsection (1) is chargeable with stamp duty as an agreement for sale by reference to the consideration mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, by the person to whom the residential property is to be transferred, under Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, by the person to whom the non-residential property is to be transferred, under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule. (Amended L.N. 231 of 2020 and 2 of 2021 s. 8)

section.name: s29BB
section.heading: Certain agreements for sale of residential property to Hong Kong permanent residents chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is a single residential property; and (Amended 18 of 2018 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) or (3) applies to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that purchaser, or each of those purchasers, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the purchasers under the agreement consist of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is a Hong Kong permanent resident; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is not a Hong Kong permanent resident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those purchasers are closely related;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: each of them is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

section.name: s29BC
section.heading: Certain agreements for sale of residential property together with car parking space to Hong Kong permanent residents chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the properties concerned are a single residential property and a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle; and (Amended 18 of 2018 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) applies to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of acquisition of the properties—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that purchaser, or each of those purchasers, is neither a beneficial owner of any other residential property, nor a beneficial owner of any other car parking space, in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a), a car parking space is permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle unless any of the following provides that the parking space may be used, at any time during the term of the Government lease in respect of the parking space or during the term of the Government lease that has been agreed for in respect of the parking space (as is appropriate), for the parking of more than 1 motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occupation permit issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other instrument which the Collector is satisfied effectively restricts the permitted user of the parking space.

section.name: s29BD
section.heading: Certain agreements for sale of residential property between closely related persons chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) or (4) applies to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is closely related to the vendor, or to each of the vendors, under the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is more than one purchaser under the agreement, the purchasers are also closely related; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that purchaser, or each of those purchasers, is acting on his or her own behalf.

subsection.content: For the purpose of subsection (2)(a), if a vendor is acting in the transaction as a trustee for another person, that other person is treated as the vendor in place of the trustee.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: the agreement is an instrument in which a purchaser under another agreement for sale of the property concerned (original agreement) makes a nomination, or gives a direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that nomination or direction authorizes another person to execute a conveyance of that property in favour of one, or more than one, third party (whether or not also in favour of the purchaser); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: on the date of that nomination or direction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the third party, or each of those parties, is closely related to the purchaser, or to each of the purchasers;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is more than one purchaser under the original agreement, the purchasers are also closely related; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the third party, or each of those parties, is acting on his or her own behalf.

section.name: s29BE
section.heading: Agreements for sale of property for replacing other property disposed of under certain Ordinances chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser under the agreement is acting on the purchaser’s own behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: the property concerned (replacement property) is acquired by the purchaser to replace another property (original property);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the original property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was owned by the purchaser alone or jointly with any other person or persons; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: falls within subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subsection (3) applies to the replacement property.

subsection.leadIn: The original property falls within this subsection if it has been—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purchased or otherwise acquired by the Urban Renewal Authority for the purposes of any of its projects as defined by section 2 of the Urban Renewal Authority Ordinance (Cap. 563);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 3 of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) or purchased by agreement under section 4A of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sold pursuant to an order for sale made by the Lands Tribunal under section 4(1)(b)(i) of the Land (Compulsory Sale for Redevelopment) Ordinance (Cap. 545);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 4(1) of the Mass Transit Railway (Land Resumption and Related Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 276);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 13(1) of the Roads (Works, Use and Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 370);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 16 or 28(1) of the Railways Ordinance (Cap. 519);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: acquired under an acquisition order made under section 3(1) or (2) of the Land Acquisition (Possessory Title) Ordinance (Cap. 130); or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 37(2) of the Land Drainage Ordinance (Cap. 446).

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the replacement property if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of disposal of the original property under subsection (2) is earlier than the date of acquisition by the purchaser of the replacement property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the original property and the replacement property are both residential properties, or both non-residential properties.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to an agreement for sale under which a replacement property is acquired by a purchaser to replace an original property if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser has acquired another replacement property to replace the original property under another instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stamp duty has been charged on that other instrument according to Scale 2 of head 1(1), or Scale 2 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule because of the operation of subsection (1) or section 29AM(1).

subsection.leadIn: If an original property was owned by more than one person, subsection (1) applies to each owner in relation to 1 replacement property acquired by the owner, regardless of whether or not the replacement property is acquired—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the owner alone; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by the owner jointly with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: another owner of the original property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other person.

section.name: s29BF
section.heading: Agreements for sale made pursuant to court orders chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates
section.content: An agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the agreement is made pursuant to a decree or order of any court.

section.name: s29BG
section.heading: Certain agreements for exchange between residential property and non-residential property chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement provides for the exchange of a residential property for a non-residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, by the purchaser under the agreement for equality.

subsection.content: An agreement that falls within subsection (1) is chargeable with stamp duty as an agreement for sale under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration mentioned in subsection (1) if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (3) or (4) applies to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that purchaser, or each of those purchasers, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is closely related to the vendor, or to each of the vendors, under the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is more than one purchaser under the agreement, the purchasers are also closely related; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that purchaser, or each of those purchasers, is acting on his or her own behalf.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, if an agreement that falls within subsection (1) provides that a person is to transfer a residential property to another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former is the vendor under the agreement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the latter is the purchaser under the agreement.

section.name: s29BH
section.heading: Certain agreements for exchange between residential properties chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement provides for the exchange of a residential property for another residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, for equality.

subsection.content: An agreement that falls within subsection (1) is chargeable with stamp duty as an agreement for sale under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration mentioned in subsection (1) if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (3) or (4) applies to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each party to the agreement is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of them is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all parties to the agreement are closely related; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf.

section.name: s29BI
section.heading: Certain agreements for sale of residential property involving additional closely related persons chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in Note 5 to head 1(1A) in the First Schedule, this section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: an agreement for sale (original agreement) is made in respect of residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: another agreement for sale (second agreement) is made in respect of the whole or part of the property (whether by the vendor or purchaser or both under the original agreement) before a conveyance on sale of the property or that part of the property is executed in pursuance of the original agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: under the second agreement, the purchasers are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: a purchaser under the original agreement (original purchaser); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person who falls within subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A person falls within this subsection if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not an original purchaser; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is, on the date of the second agreement, closely related to the original purchaser.

subsection.content: If the original agreement is duly stamped, or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the second agreement is made), the second agreement is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration for the second agreement, less a fraction of the stamp duty representing the proportion of the property that is acquired by the original purchaser under the second agreement.
For the purposes of subsection (3), joint tenants are treated as having equal undivided shares in the property concerned.
If the original agreement is not duly stamped, or not stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1), the Collector may refuse to stamp the second agreement.

section.name: s29BJ
section.heading: Certain agreements for sale of residential property involving withdrawal of closely related persons chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in Note 5 to head 1(1A) in the First Schedule, this section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: an agreement for sale (original agreement) is made in respect of residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: another agreement for sale (second agreement) is made in respect of the whole or part of the property (whether by the vendor or purchaser or both under the original agreement) before a conveyance on sale of the property or that part of the property is executed in pursuance of the original agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.def: one or some (but not all) of the purchasers under the original agreement (original purchasers) is or are the purchaser or purchasers under the second agreement (remaining purchaser or purchasers); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on the date of the second agreement, the remaining purchaser, or each of the remaining purchasers, is closely related to the withdrawn purchaser, or to each of the withdrawn purchasers.

subsection.content: If the original agreement is duly stamped, or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the second agreement is made), the second agreement is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration for the second agreement, less a fraction of the stamp duty representing the proportion of the property that was acquired by the remaining purchaser or purchasers under the original agreement.

For the purposes of subsection (2), an agreement that provides for a conveyance to purchasers as joint tenants is treated as an agreement to convey the property to those purchasers in equal undivided shares.
If the original agreement is not duly stamped, or not stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1), the Collector may refuse to stamp the second agreement.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a withdrawn purchaser is a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is one of the original purchasers; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a remaining purchaser.

section.name: s29BK
section.heading: Certain agreements for sale of residential property related to Public Rental Housing Flats under Tenants Purchase Scheme to tenants or authorized occupants chargeable with ad valorem stamp duty at Scale 2 rates

subsection.leadIn: An agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property concerned is residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the acquisition of the property is made under the Tenants Purchase Scheme of the Housing Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (2) applies to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the agreement if, on the date of acquisition of the property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is a tenant or an authorized occupant of the Housing Authority in respect of the property acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that purchaser, or each of those purchasers, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong.

section.name: s29C
section.heading: General provisions on chargeable agreements for sale

subsection.leadIn: A chargeable agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty even if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it does not contain the matters specified in section 29B(5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has not been executed by all persons who are required by section 29B(1) to execute it,

subsection.continued: or both, but the Collector may refuse to stamp the agreement. (Replaced 14 of 2011 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a chargeable agreement for sale is made in respect of immovable property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another chargeable agreement for sale is made in respect of all or any part of the property (whether by the vendor or purchaser under the first-mentioned agreement, or both) before a conveyance on sale of the property or that part of the property is made in pursuance of the first-mentioned agreement,

subsection.continued: then (subject to the notes to head 1(1A), (1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule and to section 29F) each agreement is chargeable with stamp duty. (Amended 14 of 2011 s. 7; 2 of 2014 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: The principle in subsection (3) applies, with necessary modifications, if there is a series of more than 2 chargeable agreements for sale in respect of the same, or any part of the same, immovable property; for example—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a purchaser under a chargeable agreement for sale makes a chargeable agreement for a sub-sale, and the sub-purchaser makes a further chargeable agreement for a sub-sale; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a chargeable agreement for sale is cancelled and replaced by a chargeable agreement for sale made by the vendor and a second purchaser, and that other agreement is cancelled and replaced by a chargeable agreement for sale made by the vendor and a third purchaser,

subsection.continued: then (subject to the notes to head 1(1A), (1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule and to section 29F) each agreement is chargeable with stamp duty. (Amended 14 of 2011 s. 7; 2 of 2014 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a chargeable agreement for sale is made in respect of immovable property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another chargeable agreement for sale is made in respect of all or any part of the property (whether by the vendor or purchaser under the first-mentioned agreement, or both) before a conveyance on sale of the property or that part of the property is made in pursuance of the first-mentioned agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: under the second-mentioned agreement—

subparagraph.content: the purchasers are a person named in the first-mentioned agreement as a purchaser and another person who is not so named; or
the purchaser is one, or the purchasers are some, (but not all) of the persons named in the first-mentioned agreement as the purchasers,

subsection.continued: the second-mentioned agreement shall be chargeable with stamp duty as if it were a conveyance on sale executed in pursuance of the first-mentioned agreement for sale and, except for buyer’s stamp duty, section 29D(4) or (5) (as is appropriate) shall apply accordingly. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Part, an agreement for sale to which head 1(1A), (1B) or (1C) in the First Schedule would, apart from this subsection, apply shall, subject to paragraph (b), not be regarded as an agreement for sale to which that head applies if the agreement is cancelled, annulled or rescinded or is otherwise not performed.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Where an agreement for sale described in paragraph (a) is cancelled, annulled or rescinded or is otherwise not performed by reason of the occurrence of a specified event described in subsection (5AA), despite paragraph (a), the agreement continues to be regarded as an agreement for sale to which head 1(1A), (1B) or (1C) in the First Schedule applies. (Added L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 19. Amended 14 of 2011 s. 7; 2 of 2014 s. 8)

def.name: FirstAgreement
def.leadIn: In relation to an agreement for sale made in respect of immovable property (first agreement), there is occurrence of a specified event if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: except as provided in subsection (5AB), another agreement for sale is made by the purchaser under the first agreement in which the purchaser makes a nomination or gives a direction that— (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 15)

subparagraph.content: transfers, or gives a power to transfer, any benefit of the purchaser in respect of the property or any part of the property under the first agreement; or
authorizes another person to take a conveyance of the property or any part of the property or to execute such a conveyance in favour of a third party; or (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 8; 14 of 2014 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: another agreement for sale is made in respect of the property or any part of the property—

subparagraph.content: between the vendor under the first agreement and a party introduced, directly or indirectly, to the vendor by the purchaser under the first agreement; or
under the direction of or upon the request of the purchaser. (Added 14 of 2011 s. 7)

subsection.name: 5AB
subsection.leadIn: A nomination or direction is excluded from subsection (5AA)(a) if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as it relates to head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—

subparagraph.content: the property is residential property; and
it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that subsection (5AC) applies to the nomination or direction; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in so far as it relates to head 1(1B) and (1C) in the First Schedule—

subparagraph.content: the property is residential property; and
subsection (5AD) applies to the nomination or direction. (Added 14 of 2014 s. 15)

subsection.name: 5AC
subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the nomination or direction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made or given in favour of one, or more than one, person (whether or not also in favour of the purchaser); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the date of the nomination or direction—

subparagraph.content: that person, or each of those persons, is closely related to the purchaser, or to each of the purchasers;
where there is more than one person, those persons are also closely related;
that person, or each of those persons, is acting on his or her own behalf; and
that person, or each of those persons, is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong. (Added 14 of 2014 s. 15)

subsection.name: 5AD
subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the nomination or direction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made or given in favour of one, or more than one, person (whether or not also in favour of the purchaser);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person, or each of those persons, is closely related to the purchaser, or to each of the purchasers; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where there is more than one person, those persons are also closely related. (Added 14 of 2014 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Subject to paragraph (b), if any monies have been paid under this Ordinance, whether by way of stamp duty or penalty, in respect of an agreement for sale as an agreement for sale to which head 1(1A), (1B) or (1C) in the First Schedule applies, but the agreement is under subsection (5A)(a) not regarded as an agreement for sale to which that head applies, the Collector must refund the monies paid. (Replaced 14 of 2011 s. 7. Amended 2 of 2014 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: In relation to an agreement for sale described in paragraph (a), no monies shall be refunded under paragraph (a) unless—

subparagraph.leadIn: an application has been made to the Collector—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the agreement has been cancelled, annulled or rescinded, within 2 years after the agreement has been cancelled, annulled or rescinded, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the agreement has otherwise not been performed, within 2 years after the date agreed under the agreement as the date of completion of the sale and purchase, or (in its absence) the date of conveyance, of the immovable property subject to the agreement (whether the date is determined by reference to the happening of an event or otherwise); and
such evidence, by statutory declaration or otherwise, in support of the application as the Collector may require has been produced to the Collector.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: Where any monies paid in respect of an agreement for sale are refunded under paragraph (a), the Collector may cancel— (Amended 21 of 2003 s. 14)

subparagraph.content: the stamp, if any, denoting payment of the monies on the agreement; or
the stamp certificate, where applicable, denoting payment of the monies in respect of the agreement. (Added L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 19. Amended 21 of 2003 s. 14; L.N. 150 of 2014)

subsection.content: Where a chargeable agreement for sale consists of 2 or more instruments, the principal instrument only shall be chargeable with stamp duty and the other instruments shall not be chargeable with stamp duty.
For the purposes of this Ordinance, the consideration for an agreement for sale shall be deemed to be the aggregate of the amounts and values referred to in section 29B(5)(i) and (j).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of ascertaining the manner in which a chargeable agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty, sections 22, 23 and 24 shall operate as if any reference in those sections—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a conveyance on sale were a reference to a chargeable agreement for sale;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a transferee were a reference to the purchaser under a chargeable agreement for sale;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to the property conveyed were a reference to the immovable property subject to a chargeable agreement for sale.

subsection.leadIn: Where under a chargeable agreement for sale—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exchange of any immovable property for any other immovable property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the partition of an immovable property,

subsection.continued: is agreed to, and any consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, for equality, the agreement for sale shall, subject to sections 29F, 29BG and 29BH, be charged with the same stamp duty as a chargeable agreement for sale for the consideration, and with that stamp duty only. (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 15)

subsection.content: The amendments made by section 7(9) of the Stamp Duty (Amendment) Ordinance 2011 (14 of 2011) do not apply in respect of a chargeable agreement for sale that was entered into before the date of commencement+ of that section, and subsections (11), (12) and (13) as in force immediately before that date apply to the agreement as if those amendments had not been made. (Added 14 of 2011 s. 7)

section.name: s29CA
section.heading: Further provisions on special stamp duty chargeable on certain agreements for sale

subsection.content: Head 1(1B) in the First Schedule applies to a chargeable agreement for sale of any residential property acquired on or after 20 November 2010 by the vendor under the agreement.

A chargeable agreement for sale is chargeable with special stamp duty under head 1(1B) in the First Schedule if the residential property concerned is disposed of within a period specified in the first column of that head beginning on the day on which the vendor under the agreement acquired the property. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: However, subsection (2) does not apply if the rate of stamp duty set out in head 1(1B) in the First Schedule that is applicable to the agreement for sale is 0%. (Added L.N. 26 of 2024 and 8 of 2024 s. 3)
If only part of the residential property is disposed of within a specified period, special stamp duty is chargeable only by reference to that part. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), head 1(1B) in the First Schedule does not apply to a chargeable agreement for sale if the residential property disposed of by the vendor under the agreement, or part of the residential property, consists of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any building or any part of a building (whether completed or uncompleted), and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the building is constructed, or caused to be constructed, by the vendor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the land on which the building is constructed was acquired by the vendor (irrespective of whether or not any building existed on the land before the construction commenced); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the existing building (if any) was demolished, or caused to be demolished, by the vendor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any land, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a building existed on the land when the land was acquired by the vendor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the building was demolished, or caused to be demolished, by the vendor; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: there is no building on the land at the time of disposal by the vendor.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and head 1(1B) in the First Schedule, the vendor acquired the residential property on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (6) and (9)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the vendor made a chargeable agreement for sale that provided for the conveyance of the property to the vendor; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the conveyance under which the property was transferred to or vested in the vendor; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the conveyance consisted of 2 or more instruments) the date on which the first of those instruments was made.

subsection.content: If more than one chargeable agreement for sale was made between the same parties and on the same terms in respect of a residential property, the vendor acquired the property on the date on which the first chargeable agreement for sale referred to in subsection (5)(a) was made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and head 1(1B) in the First Schedule, the vendor disposes of the residential property on, subject to subsections (8) and (9)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the vendor makes a chargeable agreement for sale that provides for the conveyance of the property from the vendor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the chargeable agreement for sale consists of 2 or more instruments) the date on which the first of those instruments is made.

subsection.content: If more than one chargeable agreement for sale is made between the same parties and on the same terms in respect of a residential property, the vendor disposes of the property on the date on which the first chargeable agreement for sale referred to in subsection (7)(a) is made.

subsection.leadIn: If a chargeable agreement for sale is made in respect of a residential property, and another chargeable agreement for sale is made in respect of all or any part of the property which is, under section 29C(5), chargeable with stamp duty as if it were a conveyance on sale executed in pursuance of the first-mentioned agreement, the property or that part of the property was acquired, and is disposed of, on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if under that other agreement the purchasers are those referred to in section 29C(5)(c)(i)) the dates specified in section 29DA(8) as if that other agreement were a conveyance on sale executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale as referred to in section 29D(4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if under that other agreement the purchaser is that, or the purchasers are those, referred to in section 29C(5)(c)(ii)) the dates specified in section 29DA(9) as if that other agreement were a conveyance on sale executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale as referred to in section 29D(5).

subsection.content: Head 1(1B) in the First Schedule does not apply to a chargeable agreement for sale if the purchaser under the agreement is a parent, spouse, child, brother or sister of the vendor under the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: Head 1(1B) in the First Schedule does not apply to a chargeable agreement for sale if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement is made pursuant to any decree or order of any court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the residential property in respect of which the agreement is made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was transferred to or vested in the vendor by or pursuant to any decree or order of any court;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: relates solely to the estate of a deceased person;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: relates solely to a bankrupt’s estate;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: relates solely to the property of a company being wound up under section 177(1)(d) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: is the subject of a sale by a mortgagee (being a financial institution within the meaning of section 2 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112)) or a receiver appointed by such a mortgagee.

subsection.content: The special stamp duty chargeable on a chargeable agreement for sale under head 1(1B) in the First Schedule is in addition to any other stamp duty with which the agreement is chargeable.
If an instrument is not chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1A) in the First Schedule, it is not chargeable with special stamp duty under head 1(1B) in that Schedule.

section.name: s29CB
section.heading: Further provisions on buyer’s stamp duty chargeable on certain agreements for sale

subsection.content: Subject to the other provisions of this section, head 1(1C) in the First Schedule applies to a chargeable agreement for sale of any residential property executed on or after 27 October 2012.

subsection.leadIn: A chargeable agreement for sale is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, under the agreement is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the purchasers under the agreement consist of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is a Hong Kong permanent resident; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is not a Hong Kong permanent resident;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those purchasers are closely related; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the purchaser or purchasers under the agreement and the vendor or each of the vendors under the agreement are closely related;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is more than one purchaser under the agreement, the purchasers are also closely related; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the purchaser or each of the purchasers is acting on his or her own behalf.

def.name: OriginalAgreement,SecondAgreement
def.leadIn: Where a chargeable agreement for sale (original agreement) is made in respect of any residential property, and another chargeable agreement for sale (second agreement) is made in respect of all or any part of the property, which is, under section 29C(5), chargeable with stamp duty as if it were a conveyance on sale executed in pursuance of the original agreement, the second agreement is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

def.name: Newcomer
def.leadIn: that the purchasers under the second agreement include one, or more than one, person (newcomer) who is not named in the original agreement as a purchaser, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the newcomer or each of the newcomers is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the newcomer or each of the newcomers is acting on his or her own behalf; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the person or persons named in the original agreement as the purchaser or purchasers and the newcomer or newcomers are closely related;

def.name: SecondAgreementPurchaser
def.leadIn: that the purchaser under the second agreement (second agreement purchaser) is one of the persons named in the original agreement as the purchasers, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the second agreement purchaser is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the second agreement purchaser is not a Hong Kong permanent resident but the other person or persons named in the original agreement as a purchaser or purchasers and the second agreement purchaser are closely related; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the second agreement purchaser is acting on his or her own behalf; or

def.name: SecondAgreementPurchasers
def.leadIn: that the purchasers under the second agreement (second agreement purchasers) are some of the persons named in the original agreement as the purchasers, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that each of the second agreement purchasers is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: each of the second agreement purchasers is acting on his or her own behalf; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the other person or persons named in the original agreement as a purchaser or purchasers and the second agreement purchasers are closely related.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), where the purchaser under a chargeable agreement for sale is not a Hong Kong permanent resident, the agreement is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the purchaser is acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the residential property concerned is acquired by the purchaser to replace another residential property that was owned by the purchaser alone or jointly with any other person or persons and that has been—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: purchased or otherwise acquired by the Urban Renewal Authority for the purposes of any of its projects as defined by section 2 of the Urban Renewal Authority Ordinance (Cap. 563);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 3 of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) or purchased by agreement under section 4A of that Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sold pursuant to an order for sale made by the Lands Tribunal under section 4(1)(b)(i) of the Land (Compulsory Sale for Redevelopment) Ordinance (Cap. 545);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 4(1) of the Mass Transit Railway (Land Resumption and Related Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 276);

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 13(1) of the Roads (Works, Use and Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 370);

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 16 or 28(1) of the Railways Ordinance (Cap. 519);

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: acquired under an acquisition order made under section 3(1) or (2) of the Land Acquisition (Possessory Title) Ordinance (Cap. 130); or

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 37(2) of the Land Drainage Ordinance (Cap. 446).

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if the property replaced was jointly owned by 2 or more than 2 persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (4) does not require the joint owners to jointly acquire a replacement property in order for that subsection to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each joint owner may acquire a replacement property alone or jointly with the other joint owner or any of the other joint owners.

subsection.leadIn: If the purchaser referred to in subsection (4) acquires the replacement property jointly with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the property replaced was owned by the purchaser alone) any other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the property replaced was owned by the purchaser jointly with any other person or persons) any person who was not a joint owner of the property replaced,

subsection.continued: subsections (2) and (3) also apply to the chargeable agreement for sale concerned as if the purchaser were a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.content: A chargeable agreement for sale is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the agreement is made pursuant to any decree or order of any court.

subsection.leadIn: If it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any purchaser under a chargeable agreement for sale is acting in the transaction as a trustee or guardian for another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other person is a Hong Kong permanent resident and is a mentally incapacitated person,

subsection.continued: the Collector must, in determining whether the agreement is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule in accordance with this section, treat the other person as a purchaser under the agreement in place of the trustee or guardian, and this section is to apply to the agreement accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any vendor under a chargeable agreement for sale is acting in the transaction as a trustee or guardian for another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other person is a Hong Kong permanent resident and is a mentally incapacitated person,

subsection.continued: the Collector must, in determining whether the agreement is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule in accordance with this section, treat the other person as a vendor under the agreement in place of the trustee or guardian, and this section is to apply to the agreement accordingly.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a chargeable agreement for sale that is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule is chargeable with that duty by reference to the full amount or value of the consideration for the agreement.
The buyer’s stamp duty chargeable on a chargeable agreement for sale under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule is in addition to any other stamp duty with which the agreement is chargeable.
If an instrument is not chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1A) in the First Schedule, it is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in that Schedule.

This section does not apply to a chargeable agreement for sale executed on or after 27 October 2012 if it was preceded by another chargeable agreement for sale executed between the same parties and on the same terms that was executed before 27 October 2012.

section.name: s29CC
section.heading: Agreements for exchange of properties

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if an agreement executed on or after 27 October 2012 provides for the exchange of any residential property for any non-residential property (whether or not any consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, for equality)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the agreement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is deemed to be a chargeable agreement for sale for the purposes of section 29CB; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: despite section 29CB(10) and (12), is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule by reference to the value of the residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or persons to whom the residential property is to be transferred is or are deemed to be the purchaser or purchasers under the agreement, and the person or persons from whom the residential property is to be transferred is or are deemed to be the vendor or vendors under the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if an agreement executed on or after 27 October 2012 provides for the exchange of any residential property for any other residential property, and any consideration is paid or given, or agreed to be paid or given, for equality—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the agreement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is deemed to be a chargeable agreement for sale for the purposes of section 29CB; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: despite section 29CB(10), is, subject to section 29F, chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or persons by whom the consideration is paid or given, or to be paid or given, is or are deemed to be the purchaser or purchasers under the agreement, and the person or persons to whom the consideration is paid or given, or to be paid or given, is or are deemed to be the vendor or vendors under the agreement.

subsection.content: An agreement that is deemed to be a chargeable agreement for sale under subsection (1) or (2) is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1C) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that, in relation to the chargeable agreement, any of the conditions set out in section 29CB(2)(a), (b) and (c) is met.

section.name: s29D
section.heading: Conveyances on sale and agreements for sale involving same immovable property

subsection.leadIn: If a conveyance on sale of immovable property is presented for stamping, or an application for stamping is made under section 18F, and the Collector has reason to believe— (Amended 21 of 2003 s. 15; 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a chargeable agreement for sale or an unwritten sale agreement that would, if it were in the form of an instrument, be a chargeable agreement for sale has been made in respect of all or any part of that property after it was vested in the vendor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, in respect of that agreement, section 29B(1) has not been complied with, or the agreement for sale has not been duly stamped or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1),

subsection.continued: the Collector may refuse to stamp the conveyance on sale.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), where a conveyance on sale of immovable property is executed in conformity with a chargeable agreement for sale and— (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement for sale is duly stamped or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the execution of the conveyance on sale), the conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty of $100;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the agreement for sale is not stamped—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1) and (if applicable) (1AA) or (1AAB) in the First Schedule; (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of subparagraph (i), the conveyance shall be deemed to have been executed on the date that the agreement for sale was made or, if the agreement for sale was preceded by an agreement for sale, or an unwritten sale agreement, made between the same parties and on the same terms, the date when the first such agreement was made; and (Amended L.N. 90 of 1999 and 44 of 1999 s. 20)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty of $100.

subsection.leadIn: Where a conveyance on sale of immovable property is executed in conformity with 2 or more agreements for sale, each relating to different parts of the property, and one or more of those agreements is a chargeable agreement for sale, then— (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if each of the chargeable agreements for sale is duly stamped or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the execution of the conveyance on sale), the conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1) and (if applicable) (1AA) or (1AAB) in the First Schedule, less the total amount of stamp duty (excluding any penalty) paid or assessed to be payable in respect of those agreements for sale;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any of the chargeable agreements for sale is not duly stamped or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1), the conveyance on sale shall not be stamped except by the Collector upon payment of the stamp duty payable in respect of the conveyance under head 1(1) and (if applicable) (1AA) or (1AAB) in the First Schedule, and any penalty payable in respect of that agreement for sale under section 9, less the total amount of stamp duty paid or assessed to be payable in respect of any of the other chargeable agreements for sale;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the conveyance on sale is duly stamped or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) before each of the chargeable agreements for sale is duly stamped, any unstamped chargeable agreement for sale is chargeable with stamp duty of $100, any chargeable agreement for sale that has been assessed remains chargeable with the amount of the stamp duty assessed, and any chargeable agreement for sale that has been stamped under section 13(2) but not assessed ceases to be chargeable with any further stamp duty. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: Where a conveyance on sale of immovable property is executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale and is in favour of a person named in the agreement as the purchaser and another person who is not so named, then— (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the agreement for sale is duly stamped or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the execution of the conveyance on sale), the conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1) and (if applicable) (1AA) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration for the conveyance, less a fraction of the stamp duty representing the proportion of the property that is vested in the person named in the agreement as the purchaser; and for the purposes of this subsection, joint tenants shall be treated as having equal undivided shares in the property; (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the agreement for sale is not so stamped—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Collector may refuse to stamp the conveyance on sale. (Replaced 14 of 2011 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Where a conveyance on sale of immovable property is executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale and is in favour of one or some (but not all) of the persons named in the agreement as the purchaser or purchasers, then— (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the agreement for sale is duly stamped, or stamped under section 5(1), 13(2) or 18E(1) (whether before or after the execution of the conveyance on sale), the conveyance on sale is chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1) and (if applicable) (1AA) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration for the conveyance, less a fraction of the stamp duty representing the proportion of the property that, according to the agreement for sale, was to be conveyed to the person or persons in whose favour the conveyance on sale was executed; and for the purposes of this subsection, an agreement that provides for a conveyance to purchasers as joint tenants shall be treated as an agreement to convey the property to those purchasers in equal undivided shares; (Amended 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the agreement for sale is not so stamped—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Collector may refuse to stamp the conveyance on sale. (Replaced 14 of 2011 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a conveyance on sale shall be deemed to be a conveyance on sale of residential property unless it contains a statement certifying that the immovable property subject to the conveyance is non-residential property within the meaning of section 29A(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a conveyance on sale that contains such a statement may be shown to be a conveyance on sale of residential property;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a conveyance on sale is not executed in conformity with an agreement for sale unless the conveyance on sale—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is of the whole or part of the immovable property subject to the agreement for sale; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (7), is in favour of the person or all persons named in the agreement for sale as the purchaser or purchasers and no other person; (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 11; 14 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a conveyance on sale is not executed in pursuance of an agreement for sale unless the conveyance on sale is of the whole or part of the immovable property subject to the agreement for sale and is not executed in conformity with the agreement for sale;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a reference in subsection (3) to an agreement for sale includes a reference to an agreement for sale made before the commencement of the Stamp Duty (Amendment) Ordinance 1992 (8 of 1992).

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (6)(c)(ii), if the property concerned is residential property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of head 1(1) in the First Schedule, 2 or more persons are treated as the same person if, on the date of the conveyance concerned—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: they are closely related;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the person, or each of the persons, in whose favour the conveyance is executed is not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of head 1(1AA) and (1AAB) in the First Schedule, 2 or more persons are treated as the same person if they are closely related. (Added 14 of 2014 s. 18)

subsection.content: Despite section 71(3) and (4), a reference in subsection (3) to an agreement for sale includes an agreement for sale of non-residential property made before 23 February 2013. (Added 14 of 2014 s. 18)

section.name: s29DA
section.heading: Further provisions on special stamp duty chargeable on certain conveyances on sale

subsection.content: Head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule applies to a conveyance on sale of any residential property acquired on or after 20 November 2010 by the transferor under the conveyance on sale.

A conveyance on sale is chargeable with special stamp duty under head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule if the residential property concerned is disposed of within a period specified in the first column of that head beginning on the day on which the transferor under the conveyance on sale acquired the property. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 12)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: However, subsection (2) does not apply if the rate of stamp duty set out in head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule that is applicable to the conveyance on sale is 0%. (Added L.N. 26 of 2024 and 8 of 2024 s. 4)
If only part of the residential property is disposed of within a specified period, special stamp duty is chargeable only by reference to that part. (Amended 2 of 2014 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule does not apply to a conveyance on sale if the residential property disposed of by the transferor under the conveyance on sale, or part of the residential property, consists of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any building or any part of a building (whether completed or uncompleted), and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the building is constructed, or caused to be constructed, by the transferor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the land on which the building is constructed was acquired by the transferor (irrespective of whether or not any building existed on the land before the construction commenced); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the existing building (if any) was demolished, or caused to be demolished, by the transferor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any land, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a building existed on the land when the land was acquired by the transferor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the building was demolished, or caused to be demolished, by the transferor; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: there is no building on the land at the time of disposal by the transferor.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule, the transferor acquired the residential property on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (6), (8) and (9)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of the conveyance under which the property was transferred to or vested in the transferor; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the conveyance consisted of 2 or more instruments) the date on which the first of those instruments was made.

subsection.content: If more than one chargeable agreement for sale was made between the same parties and on the same terms in respect of a residential property, the transferor acquired the property on the date on which the first chargeable agreement for sale referred to in subsection (5)(a) was made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule, the transferor disposes of the residential property on, subject to subsections (8) and (9) and section 29CA(7), (8) and (9)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the conveyance on sale of the property under which the property is transferred or divested from the transferor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the conveyance on sale consists of 2 or more instruments) the date on which the first of those instruments is made.

def.name: ThatPurchaser
def.leadIn: In the case of a conveyance on sale of residential property executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale as referred to in section 29D(4), the person named in the agreement as the purchaser (that purchaser)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: acquired the property on—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disposes of the proportion of the property to be vested in the other person not named in the agreement as a purchaser as referred to in that section on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the conveyance on sale is executed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the conveyance on sale consists of 2 or more instruments) the date on which the first of those instruments is made.

def.name: ThatPerson
def.leadIn: In the case of a conveyance on sale of residential property executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale as referred to in section 29D(5), a person named in the agreement as one of the purchasers (that person), if the conveyance on sale is not executed in favour of that person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: acquired that person’s proportion of the property on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which that person, together with the other person or persons named in the agreement as a purchaser or purchasers as referred to in that section, made a chargeable agreement for sale that provided for the conveyance of the property to that person and that other person or persons; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disposes of that person’s proportion of the property on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the conveyance on sale is executed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the conveyance on sale consists of 2 or more instruments) the date on which the first of those instruments is made.

subsection.content: Head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule does not apply to a conveyance on sale if the person to whom the residential property is vested or transferred under the conveyance on sale is a parent, spouse, child, brother or sister of the transferor under the conveyance on sale.

subsection.leadIn: Head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule does not apply to a conveyance on sale of residential property if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conveyance on sale is, or is executed pursuant to, any decree or order of any court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was transferred to or vested in the transferor by or pursuant to any decree or order of any court;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: relates solely to the estate of a deceased person;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: relates solely to a bankrupt’s estate;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: relates solely to the property of a company being wound up under section 177(1)(d) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: is the subject of a sale by a mortgagee (being a financial institution within the meaning of section 2 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112)) or a receiver appointed by such a mortgagee.

subsection.content: The special stamp duty chargeable on a conveyance on sale under head 1(1AA) in the First Schedule is in addition to any other stamp duty with which the conveyance on sale is chargeable.
If an instrument is not chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1) in the First Schedule, it is not chargeable with special stamp duty under head 1(1AA) in that Schedule.
Paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d) of section 29D(6) also apply for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s29DB
section.heading: Further provisions on buyer’s stamp duty chargeable on certain conveyances on sale

subsection.content: Subject to the other provisions of this section, head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule applies to a conveyance on sale of any residential property executed on or after 27 October 2012.

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the transferee, or each of the transferees, under the conveyance is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the transferees under the conveyance consist of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is a Hong Kong permanent resident; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: one, or more than one, person who is not a Hong Kong permanent resident;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those transferees are closely related; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: each of them is acting on his or her own behalf; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the transferee or transferees under the conveyance and the transferor or each of the transferors under the conveyance are closely related;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is more than one transferee under the conveyance, the transferees are also closely related; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the transferee or each of the transferees is acting on his or her own behalf.

def.name: Newcomer
def.leadIn: Where a conveyance on sale is executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale as referred to in section 29D(4), and the transferees under the conveyance include one, or more than one, person (newcomer) who is not named in the agreement as a purchaser, the conveyance is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the newcomer or each of the newcomers is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the newcomer or each of the newcomers is acting on his or her own behalf; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person or persons named in the agreement as the purchaser or purchasers and the newcomer or newcomers are closely related.

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale that is executed in pursuance of a chargeable agreement for sale as referred to in section 29D(5) is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the transferee under the conveyance is one of the persons named in the agreement as the purchasers, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the transferee is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the transferee is not a Hong Kong permanent resident but the other person or persons named in the agreement as a purchaser or purchasers and the transferee are closely related; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the transferee is acting on his or her own behalf; or

paragraph.name: b
