paragraph.leadIn: that the transferees under the conveyance are some of the persons named in the agreement as the purchasers, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that each of the transferees is a Hong Kong permanent resident acting on his or her own behalf; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: each of the transferees is acting on his or her own behalf; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the other person or persons named in the agreement as a purchaser or purchasers and the transferees are closely related.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (6) and (7), where the transferee under a conveyance on sale is not a Hong Kong permanent resident, the conveyance is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the transferee is acting on his or her own behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the residential property concerned is acquired by the transferee to replace another residential property that was owned by the transferee alone or jointly with any other person or persons and that has been—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: purchased or otherwise acquired by the Urban Renewal Authority for the purposes of any of its projects as defined by section 2 of the Urban Renewal Authority Ordinance (Cap. 563);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 3 of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124) or purchased by agreement under section 4A of that Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sold pursuant to an order for sale made by the Lands Tribunal under section 4(1)(b)(i) of the Land (Compulsory Sale for Redevelopment) Ordinance (Cap. 545);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 4(1) of the Mass Transit Railway (Land Resumption and Related Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 276);

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 13(1) of the Roads (Works, Use and Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 370);

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 16 or 28(1) of the Railways Ordinance (Cap. 519);

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: acquired under an acquisition order made under section 3(1) or (2) of the Land Acquisition (Possessory Title) Ordinance (Cap. 130); or

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: resumed under an order made under section 37(2) of the Land Drainage Ordinance (Cap. 446).

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if the property replaced was jointly owned by 2 or more than 2 persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (5) does not require the joint owners to jointly acquire a replacement property in order for that subsection to apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each joint owner may acquire a replacement property alone or jointly with the other joint owner or any of the other joint owners.

subsection.leadIn: If the transferee referred to in subsection (5) acquires the replacement property jointly with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the property replaced was owned by the transferee alone) any other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the property replaced was owned by the transferee jointly with any other person or persons) any person who was not a joint owner of the property replaced,

subsection.continued: subsections (2), (3) and (4) also apply to the conveyance on sale concerned as if the transferee were a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance on sale is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conveyance is made pursuant to any decree or order of any court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conveyance is a decree or order of any court by which the residential property concerned is transferred to or vested in the transferee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: under the conveyance, a mortgaged property is transferred to or vested in its mortgagee that is a financial institution within the meaning of section 2 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) or a receiver appointed by the mortgagee.

subsection.leadIn: If it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any transferee under a conveyance on sale is acting in the transaction as a trustee or guardian for another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other person is a Hong Kong permanent resident and is a mentally incapacitated person,

subsection.continued: the Collector must, in determining whether the conveyance is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule in accordance with this section, treat the other person as a transferee under the conveyance in place of the trustee or guardian, and this section is to apply to the conveyance accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any transferor under a conveyance on sale is acting in the transaction as a trustee or guardian for another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other person is a Hong Kong permanent resident and is a mentally incapacitated person,

subsection.continued: the Collector must, in determining whether the conveyance is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule in accordance with this section, treat the other person as a transferor under the conveyance in place of the trustee or guardian, and this section is to apply to the conveyance accordingly.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a conveyance on sale that is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule is chargeable with that duty by reference to the full amount or value of the consideration for the conveyance.
The buyer’s stamp duty chargeable on a conveyance on sale under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule is in addition to any other stamp duty with which the conveyance is chargeable.
If an instrument is not chargeable with stamp duty under head 1(1) in the First Schedule, it is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in that Schedule.
Paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d) of section 29D(6) also apply for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s29DC
section.heading: Instruments effecting exchange of properties

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if the exchange of any residential property for any non-residential property is effected by an instrument that is executed on or after 27 October 2012 (whether or not any consideration is paid or given for equality)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the instrument—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is deemed to be a conveyance on sale for the purposes of section 29DB; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: despite section 29DB(11) and (13), is chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule by reference to the value of the residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or persons to whom the residential property is transferred is or are deemed to be the transferee or transferees under the conveyance, and the person or persons from whom the residential property is transferred is or are deemed to be the transferor or transferors under the conveyance.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), if the exchange of any residential property for any other residential property is effected by an instrument that is executed on or after 27 October 2012, and any consideration is paid or given for equality—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the instrument—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is deemed to be a conveyance on sale for the purposes of section 29DB; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: despite section 29DB(11), is, subject to section 29F, chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule by reference to the consideration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or persons by whom the consideration is paid or given is or are deemed to be the transferee or transferees under the conveyance, and the person or persons to whom the consideration is paid or given is or are deemed to be the transferor or transferors under the conveyance.

subsection.content: An instrument that is deemed to be a conveyance on sale under subsection (1) or (2) is not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty under head 1(1AAB) in the First Schedule if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that, in relation to the conveyance, any of the conditions set out in section 29DB(2)(a), (b) and (c) is met.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Refund of Stamp Duty in case of Redevelopment

section.name: s29DD
section.heading: Refund of buyer’s stamp duty in case of redevelopment

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance and subject to subsection (2), the Collector may, on an application made by a person (applicant) who had paid buyer’s stamp duty in respect of an instrument, refund the buyer’s stamp duty if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the residential property concerned consisted, or formed part, of a lot (the lot);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: alone or jointly with an associated body corporate within the meaning of section 45(2), became the owner of the lot; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: after becoming the owner as mentioned in subparagraph (i), was, alone or jointly with the associated body corporate, granted a new lot (the new lot) by the Government consequent on either or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the surrender to the Government of the lot (wholly or partly and whether or not together with any other lot);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the acquisition by the Government through purchase by agreement under section 4A of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124), or resumption by the Government under an order made under section 3 of that Ordinance, of the lot (wholly or partly and whether or not together with any other lot); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant, alone or jointly with the associated body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: has—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: demolished or caused to be demolished all buildings (if any) existing on the lot or the new lot, other than a building or part of a building the demolition of which is prohibited under any Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: obtained approval of plans and details prescribed in regulation 8(1)(a), (b), (f), (g), (h), (j), (k) and (m) of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A) in respect of building works to be carried out on the lot or the new lot (whether or not together with any other lot) from the Building Authority under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has obtained consent to commence any foundation works for the lot or the new lot (whether or not together with any other lot) from the Building Authority under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a residential property was acquired by a body corporate (first body corporate) under an instrument in respect of which it had paid buyer’s stamp duty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the property was subsequently transferred to another body corporate (second body corporate)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the first body corporate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: through one or more than one other body corporate (other bodies corporate); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the instrument effecting the transfer of the property to the second body corporate and (if applicable) the instruments effecting the transfer of the property to the other bodies corporate were, by virtue of section 45, not chargeable with buyer’s stamp duty,

subsection.continued: the second body corporate may also apply to the Collector under subsection (1) for a refund to the second body corporate of the buyer’s stamp duty paid by the first body corporate in respect of the instrument referred to in paragraph (a), and such an application is to be treated by the Collector as if the second body corporate were the person who had paid the buyer’s stamp duty.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, in relation to a lot that has been divided into undivided shares, a person does not become the owner of the lot until the person is the legal owner of all the undivided shares in the lot.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: lot (地段) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Land (Compulsory Sale for Redevelopment) Ordinance (Cap. 545).

section.name: s29DE
section.heading: Partial refund of ad valorem stamp duty in case of redevelopment

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable instrument (適用文書) means an instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule;

def.name: SpecifiedAmount
def.leadIn: specified amount (指明款項) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an applicable instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid and the stamp duty that would have been payable on that instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an applicable instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid and the stamp duty that would have been payable on that instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has paid stamp duty on an applicable instrument according to Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in subsection (3) are satisfied in relation to the immovable property concerned,

subsection.continued: the Collector may, on an application made by the person, refund to the person the specified amount.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: the immovable property concerned consisted, or formed part, of a lot (the lot);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: alone or jointly with an associated body corporate within the meaning of section 45(2), became the owner of the lot; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: after becoming the owner as mentioned in subparagraph (i), was, alone or jointly with the associated body corporate, granted a new lot (the new lot) by the Government consequent on either or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the surrender to the Government of the lot (wholly or partly and whether or not together with any other lot);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the acquisition by the Government through purchase by agreement under section 4A of the Lands Resumption Ordinance (Cap. 124), or resumption by the Government under an order made under section 3 of that Ordinance, of the lot (wholly or partly and whether or not together with any other lot); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the person, alone or jointly with the associated body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: has—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: demolished or caused to be demolished all buildings (if any) existing on the lot or the new lot, other than a building or part of a building the demolition of which is prohibited under any Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: obtained approval of plans and details prescribed in regulation 8(1)(a), (b), (f), (g), (h), (j), (k) and (m) of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A) in respect of building works to be carried out on the lot or the new lot (whether or not together with any other lot) from the Building Authority under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has obtained consent to commence any foundation works for the lot or the new lot (whether or not together with any other lot) from the Building Authority under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: immovable property was acquired by a body corporate (first body corporate) under an instrument on which it had paid stamp duty according to Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: the property was subsequently transferred by the first body corporate to another body corporate (second body corporate) directly or through one, or more than one, other body corporate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the instrument or instruments effecting the transfer of the property to the second body corporate were, by virtue of section 45, not chargeable with stamp duty,

subsection.continued: the second body corporate is regarded, for the purposes of subsection (2)(a), as the person who has paid the stamp duty on the instrument as described in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, in relation to a lot that has been divided into undivided shares, a person becomes the owner of the lot when the person becomes the legal owner of all the undivided shares in the lot.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: lot (地段) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Land (Compulsory Sale for Redevelopment) Ordinance (Cap. 545).

division.name: D6
division.heading: Further Provisions on Ad Valorem Stamp Duty

section.name: s29DF
section.heading: Partial refund of ad valorem stamp duty on disposal of residential property in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ApplicableInstrument
def.leadIn: applicable instrument (適用文書) means an instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under which a residential property (whether or not together with a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle) is acquired; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule;

subsection.def: original property (原物業), in relation to a person who acquires a subject property under an applicable instrument, means another residential property (whether or not together with a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle) of which the person is a beneficial owner on the date of that acquisition;

def.name: SpecifiedAmount
def.leadIn: specified amount (指明款項) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an applicable instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid and the stamp duty that would have been payable on that instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule in accordance with Division 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an applicable instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid and the stamp duty that would have been payable on that instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule in accordance with Division 3;

subsection.def: subject property (標的物業) means the residential property, or the residential property and car parking space, acquired under an applicable instrument.

def.name: Applicant
def.leadIn: The Collector may, on an application made by a person (applicant) who had paid stamp duty on an applicable instrument, refund to the applicant the specified amount if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (3) or (4) applies to the disposal of an original property of the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had the original property been disposed of before the subject property was acquired, the applicable instrument would have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 2 of head 1(1), or Scale 2 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the disposal of an original property of the applicant if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the original property is disposed of by the applicant under an agreement for sale that is made within the period specified in subsection (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the original property is transferred or divested from the applicant under a conveyance on sale executed in conformity with that agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application for refund is made by the applicant not later than 2 years after the date of the applicable instrument, or not later than 2 months after the date of the conveyance on sale under which the original property is transferred or divested, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to the disposal of an original property of the applicant if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the original property is transferred or divested from the applicant under a conveyance on sale within the period specified in subsection (5); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application for refund is made by the applicant not later than 2 years after the date of the applicable instrument, or not later than 2 months after the date of the conveyance on sale under which the original property is transferred or divested, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: For subsections (3)(a) and (4)(a), the following period is specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicable instrument is a conveyance on sale—12 months after the date of that instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicable instrument is an agreement for sale—12 months after the date of the conveyance on sale executed in conformity with the agreement for sale. (Replaced 2 of 2018 s. 9)

def.name: ApplicableInstrument,OriginalProperty
def.leadIn: For the definitions of applicable instrument and original property in subsection (1), a car parking space is permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle unless any of the following provides that the parking space may be used, at any time during the term of the Government lease in respect of the parking space or during the term of the Government lease that has been agreed for in respect of the parking space (as is appropriate), for the parking of more than 1 motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occupation permit issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other instrument which the Collector is satisfied effectively restricts the permitted user of the parking space.

section.name: s29DG
section.heading: Further ad valorem stamp duty payable on failure to complete disposal of residential property in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ApplicableInstrument
def.leadIn: applicable instrument (適用文書) means an instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under which a residential property (whether or not together with a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle) is acquired; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on which stamp duty had been paid—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29AJ, 29AK, 29AO(1) to (3), or 29AP(1) to (3); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29BB, 29BC, 29BG(1) to (3), or 29BH(1) to (3);

subsection.def: original property (原物業), in relation to a person who acquires a subject property under an applicable instrument, means another residential property (whether or not together with a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle) of which the person is a beneficial owner before that acquisition;

def.name: SpecifiedAmount
def.leadIn: specified amount (指明款項) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an applicable instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid and the stamp duty that would have been payable on that instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an applicable instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid and the stamp duty that would have been payable on that instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule;

subsection.def: subject property (標的物業) means the residential property, or the residential property and car parking space, acquired under an applicable instrument.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: a person has disposed of an original property under an agreement for sale (original agreement) before the person acquires a subject property under an applicable instrument;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had that original property not been disposed of before the subject property was acquired, the applicable instrument would have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: after that acquisition, the original agreement is cancelled, annulled or rescinded or is otherwise not performed in circumstances that would qualify that agreement not to be regarded as one to which head 1(1A) in the First Schedule applies under section 29C(5A); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the stamp duty paid on the original agreement is refunded to the person under section 29C(5B).

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 4(5) and the fact that the applicable instrument may have been stamped according to section 13(1), the person is liable civilly to the Collector for the payment, within 30 days after the date the refund mentioned in subsection (2)(d) is made, of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified amount for that instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interest on the specified amount at the rate of 4 cents per $100 or part of $100 per day for the period beginning on the expiration of 1 month from the expiration of the time for stamping that instrument, and ending on the date of payment of the specified amount.

subsection.content: The Collector may remit, wholly or in part, any interest payable under subsection (3).

def.name: ApplicableInstrument,OriginalProperty
def.leadIn: For the definitions of applicable instrument and original property in subsection (1), a car parking space is permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle unless any of the following provides that the parking space may be used, at any time during the term of the Government lease in respect of the parking space or during the term of the Government lease that has been agreed for in respect of the parking space (as is appropriate), for the parking of more than 1 motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occupation permit issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other instrument which the Collector is satisfied effectively restricts the permitted user of the parking space.

section.name: s29DH
section.heading: Liability for underpayment of ad valorem stamp duty in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable agreement (適用協議) means an instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29BB, 29BC, 29BG(1) to (3), or 29BH(1) to (3);

applicable conveyance (適用轉易契) means an instrument on which stamp duty had been paid according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29AJ, 29AK, 29AO(1) to (3), or 29AP(1) to (3);

def.name: SpecifiedAmount
def.leadIn: specified amount (指明款項) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an applicable conveyance—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid on it and the stamp duty that would have been payable if it were chargeable under Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an applicable agreement—an amount equal to the difference between the stamp duty paid on it and the stamp duty that would have been payable if it were chargeable under Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies to the transferee, or each of the transferees, who acquires a residential property (whether or not together with a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle) under an applicable conveyance if the Collector expresses an opinion under section 13 that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the conveyance according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29AJ—the conveyance should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because section 29AJ(1)(b) was not satisfied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the conveyance according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29AK—the conveyance should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because section 29AK(1)(b) was not satisfied;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the conveyance according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29AO(1) to (3)—the conveyance should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because section 29AO(2) and (3) was not satisfied; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the conveyance according to Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29AP(1) to (3)—the conveyance should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule because section 29AP(2) and (3) was not satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 4(3) and paragraph (C) in head 1(1) in the First Schedule, the transferee or transferees under the conveyance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is liable, or are jointly and severally liable, civilly to the Collector for the payment of the specified amount for the conveyance and any penalty payable under section 9; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if there is more than one transferee) may be proceeded against without reference to any civil liability of those transferees inter se for the payment of the specified amount and penalty.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies to the purchaser, or each of the purchasers, who acquires a residential property (whether or not together with a car parking space permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle) under an applicable agreement if the Collector expresses an opinion under section 13 that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the agreement according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29BB—the agreement should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because section 29BB(1)(b) was not satisfied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the agreement according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29BC—the agreement should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because section 29BC(1)(b) was not satisfied;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the agreement according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29BG(1) to (3)—the agreement should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because section 29BG(2) and (3) was not satisfied; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if stamp duty had been paid on the agreement according to Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because of the operation of section 29BH(1) to (3)—the agreement should have been chargeable with stamp duty under Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule because section 29BH(2) and (3) was not satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 4(3) and paragraph (C) in head 1(1A) in the First Schedule, the purchaser or purchasers under the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is liable, or are jointly and severally liable, civilly to the Collector for the payment of the specified amount for the agreement and any penalty payable under section 9; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if there is more than one purchaser) may be proceeded against without reference to any civil liability of those purchasers inter se for the payment of the specified amount and penalty.

subsection.leadIn: For subsections (2) and (4), a car parking space is permitted for the parking of 1 motor vehicle unless any of the following provides that the parking space may be used, at any time during the term of the Government lease in respect of the parking space or during the term of the Government lease that has been agreed for in respect of the parking space (as is appropriate), for the parking of more than 1 motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government lease or an agreement for a Government lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a deed of mutual covenant, within the meaning of section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an occupation permit issued under section 21 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other instrument which the Collector is satisfied effectively restricts the permitted user of the parking space.

division.name: D6A
division.heading: Stamp Duty Treatment for Hong Kong Permanent Residents Admitted into Hong Kong under Certain Admission Schemes

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Preliminary
subdivision.sourceNote: (Subdivision 1 added L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 7)

section.name: s29DHA
section.heading: Interpretation (Division 6A)

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: specified scheme (指明計劃) means a scheme (including a policy or arrangement) that is specified in Schedule 12.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, a person is covered by a specified scheme if the person, despite not being a Hong Kong permanent resident, is permitted to stay in Hong Kong by virtue of being a person to whom a specified scheme applies.

In this Division, a reference to a person’s being permitted to stay in Hong Kong is a reference to the person’s being permitted to stay in Hong Kong pursuant to the exercise of a power under the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an agreement for sale of a residential property is unperformed if the agreement is cancelled, annulled or rescinded or is otherwise not performed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such an agreement remains outstanding if the agreement provides for the conveyance of the residential property concerned but the conveyance is not yet executed.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Refund of Certain Amounts of Stamp Duty

section.name: s29DI
section.heading: Interpretation (Subdivision 2)
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision— (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 8)

def.name: ApplicableInstrument
def.leadIn: applicable instrument (適用文書) means an instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under which a single residential property is acquired; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on which—

subparagraph.content: buyer’s stamp duty had been paid; and

def.name: Cobuyer
def.leadIn: co-buyer (共同買家), in relation to an application made under section 29DJ(1), means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who, jointly with the applicant, acquired the subject property as mentioned in section 29DJ(1)(b)(ii);

section.def: subject property (標的物業), in relation to an applicable instrument, means the residential property acquired under the instrument.

section.name: s29DJ
section.heading: Application for refund

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 29DK and 29DL, the Collector may, on an application made by a person who had paid stamp duty on an applicable instrument, refund the specified amount to the person if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the date of the person’s acquisition of the subject property falls— (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 9)

subparagraph.content: on or after 19 October 2022; and
before 25 October 2023; and (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the person—

subparagraph.content: if the person alone acquired the subject property under the instrument—the conditions specified in subsection (2) are met; or
if the person, jointly with one or more than one other person, acquired the subject property under the instrument—the conditions specified in subsection (3) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsection (1)(b)(i) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that on the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property—

subparagraph.content: the applicant was acting on his or her own behalf; and
the applicant was covered by a specified scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the applicant—

subparagraph.leadIn: is not a vendor under an agreement for sale of any other residential property in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that was made before the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that is unperformed, or otherwise remains outstanding, on the date of the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that on the date of the application—

subparagraph.content: the applicant remains a beneficial owner of the subject property; and

subparagraph.leadIn: no person other than one who falls within the following descriptions is a beneficial owner of the subject property in addition to the applicant—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the person is closely related to the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the person was acting on his or her own behalf on the date of his or her acquisition of the subject property; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the applicant has after the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property become, and on the date of the application remains, a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the conditions specified for subsection (1)(b)(ii) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property—

subparagraph.content: each of the co-buyers was acting on his or her own behalf; and
each of the co-buyers was covered by a specified scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that each of the co-buyers—

subparagraph.leadIn: is not a vendor under an agreement for sale of any other residential property in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that was made before the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that is unperformed, or otherwise remains outstanding, on the date of the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that on the date of the application—

subparagraph.content: at least one co-buyer who was, on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property, covered by a specified scheme (specified co-buyer) remains a beneficial owner of the subject property; and

subparagraph.leadIn: no person other than one who falls within the following descriptions is a beneficial owner of the subject property in addition to the specified co-buyer—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the person is closely related to all of the co-buyers; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the person was acting on his or her own behalf on the date of his or her acquisition of the subject property; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that each of the remaining co-buyers has after the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property become, and on the date of the application remains, a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.leadIn: If all the co-buyers were closely related on the date of their acquisition of the subject property, the condition specified in subsection (3)(a)(ii) is taken to be met so long as, on that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant was covered by a specified scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of the co-buyers other than the applicant was not a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedAmount
def.leadIn: specified amount (指明款項), in relation to an applicable instrument, means the sum of the amounts under paragraphs (a) and (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an amount equal to the difference between—

subparagraph.content: if the instrument is one on which stamp duty had been paid according to Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule—the stamp duty so paid on the instrument and the stamp duty that would have been payable on the instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule in accordance with Division 2; or

if the instrument is one on which stamp duty had been paid according to Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—the stamp duty so paid on the instrument and the stamp duty that would have been payable on the instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule in accordance with Division 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of buyer’s stamp duty paid on the instrument. (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 9)

section.name: s29DK
section.heading: Applicants or co-buyers regarded as not being beneficial owners of other residential properties in certain circumstances

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies if section 29DJ(1)(b)(i) is relied on in making an application under section 29DJ(1).

Even if, on the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property concerned, the applicant was a beneficial owner of another residential property in Hong Kong (original property A), the applicant is, for the purposes of section 29DJ(2)(b)(i), taken not to be a beneficial owner of original property A on that date if the conditions specified in subsection (3) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

subparagraph.leadIn: original property A is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: disposed of by the applicant under an agreement for sale that is made within the period specified in subsection (7); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: transferred or divested from the applicant under a conveyance on sale that is executed in conformity with the agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that, but for the subject property and original property A, the applicant would not be a beneficial owner of any residential property in Hong Kong on the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that no refund has been made under this Subdivision in respect of original property A. (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 10)

subsection.content: Subsection (5) applies if section 29DJ(1)(b)(ii) is relied on in making an application under section 29DJ(1).

subsection.leadIn: Even if, on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property concerned, any one of the co-buyers was a beneficial owner of another residential property in Hong Kong (original property B), that co-buyer is, for the purposes of section 29DJ(3)(b)(i), taken not to be a beneficial owner of original property B on that date if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that co-buyer is a remaining co-buyer—the conditions specified in subsection (6)(a), (b) and (c) are met; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the condition specified in subsection (6)(b) is met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsection (5) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

subparagraph.leadIn: original property B is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: disposed of by the co-buyer under an agreement for sale that is made within the period specified in subsection (7); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: transferred or divested from the co-buyer under a conveyance on sale that is executed in conformity with the agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that, but for the subject property and original property B, each of the co-buyers would not be a beneficial owner of any residential property in Hong Kong on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that no refund has been made under this Subdivision in respect of original property B. (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for the purposes of subsections (3)(a)(i)(A) and (ii) and (6)(a)(i)(A) and (ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicable instrument is a conveyance on sale—12 months after the date of the conveyance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicable instrument is an agreement for sale—12 months after the date of the conveyance on sale executed in conformity with the agreement.

section.name: s29DL
section.heading: Deadline for application
section.leadIn: No refund may be made under this Subdivision if the application for refund is made after— (Amended L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), 6 months after—

subparagraph.content: the date* on which the Stamp Duty (Amendment) (No. 3) Ordinance 2023 (14 of 2023) is published in the Gazette; or

subparagraph.leadIn: the date on which—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: if section 29DJ(1)(b)(ii) is relied on in making the application—the person who, among the remaining co-buyers, last became a Hong Kong permanent resident became such a resident,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if section 29DK is relied on in making the application—

subparagraph.content: 6 months after the date mentioned in paragraph (a)(i);
6 months after the date mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii);
2 years after the date of the applicable instrument; or

subparagraph.leadIn: 2 months after the date of the conveyance on sale under which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if section 29DJ(1)(b)(i) is relied on in making the application—original property A is transferred or divested as mentioned in section 29DK(3)(a); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if section 29DJ(1)(b)(ii) is relied on in making the application—original property B is transferred or divested as mentioned in section 29DK(6)(a),

editorialNote.content: * Date of publication in the Gazette: 30 June 2023.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Suspension of and Waiver of Liabilities in respect of Certain Amounts of Stamp Duty
subdivision.sourceNote: (Subdivision 3 added L.N. 148 of 2023 and 3 of 2024 s. 12)

section.name: s29DM
section.heading: Interpretation (Subdivision 3)

subsection.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
subsection.def: Cap. 128 (《第128章》) means the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128);
deadline for waiver (寬免期限)—see section 29DS;
remaining co-buyer (餘下共同買家) means a co-buyer who remains a beneficial owner of the subject property concerned;

specified amount (指明款項), in relation to an applicable instrument, means the sum of the amounts under paragraphs (a) and (b)—(a)an amount equal to the difference between—(i)if the instrument is one on which, but for this Subdivision, stamp duty would have been payable according to Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule—(A)the stamp duty so payable on the instrument; and(B)the stamp duty that would have been payable on the instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1) in the First Schedule in accordance with Division 2; or(ii)if the instrument is one on which, but for this Subdivision, stamp duty would have been payable according to Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule—(A)the stamp duty so payable on the instrument; and(B)the stamp duty that would have been payable on the instrument if it were chargeable under Scale 2 of head 1(1A) in the First Schedule in accordance with Division 3;(b)the amount of buyer’s stamp duty that would have been payable on the instrument but for this Subdivision;

specified charge (指明押記), in relation to an applicable instrument, means—(a)if the instrument is an agreement for sale—an equitable charge constituted in respect of the instrument under section 29DP(2) (including such a charge that is taken to be a legal charge under section 29DP(7)); or(b)if the instrument is a conveyance on sale—a legal charge constituted in respect of the instrument under section 29DP(3);
subject property (標的物業), in relation to an applicable instrument, means the residential property acquired under the instrument.

subsection.content: The words and expressions used in Schedule 13 and defined in this section for the purposes of this Subdivision have the same meaning as in this Subdivision.

section.name: s29DN
section.heading: Application for suspension of liabilities in respect of specified amounts

subsection.content: A person who has acquired a subject property under an applicable instrument may, when the instrument is presented to the Collector for stamping under this Ordinance, make an application for suspension of the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may approve the application if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property concerned falls on or after 25 October 2023;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the applicant—

subparagraph.content: if the applicant alone acquired the property under the applicable instrument—the conditions specified in subsection (3) are met; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a fee specified by the Collector has been paid in respect of the application.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsection (2)(b)(i) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that on the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property—

subparagraph.content: the applicant was acting on his or her own behalf;
the applicant was covered by a specified scheme; and
the applicant was not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the applicant is not a vendor under an agreement for sale of any other residential property in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.content: that was made before the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property; and
that is unperformed, or otherwise remains outstanding, on the date of the application.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsection (2)(b)(ii) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property—

subparagraph.content: each of the co-buyers was acting on his or her own behalf;

subparagraph.leadIn: at least one of the co-buyers was covered by a specified scheme, and—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: each of the co-buyers who were not so covered was a Hong Kong permanent resident; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: all the co-buyers were closely related; and
each of the co-buyers was not a beneficial owner of any other residential property in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that each of the co-buyers is not a vendor under an agreement for sale of any other residential property in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.content: that was made before the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property; and
that is unperformed, or otherwise remains outstanding, on the date of the application.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is approved under subsection (2) in relation to an applicable instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount is suspended until any one of the triggering circumstances specified in section 29DU occurs in relation to the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument is to be stamped with a stamp, or by way of a stamp certificate, denoting that the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been suspended under this Subdivision.

section.name: s29DO
section.heading: Application for refund of and suspension of liabilities in respect of specified amounts in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies in relation to a buyer in respect of an applicable instrument if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date of the buyer’s acquisition of the subject property, the buyer was a beneficial owner of another residential property in Hong Kong (original property A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the instrument is one on which—

subparagraph.content: buyer’s stamp duty has been paid; and
stamp duty has been paid according to Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The buyer may make an application for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the refund of an amount that would be the specified amount for the applicable instrument had section 29DN been applied in relation to the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the suspension of the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of such an amount.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may approve the application if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

subparagraph.leadIn: original property A is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: disposed of by the applicant under an agreement for sale that is made within the period specified in subsection (7); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: transferred or divested from the applicant under a conveyance on sale that is executed in conformity with the agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that, had the applicant not been a beneficial owner of original property A on the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property, the conditions in section 29DN(2) would have been met in relation to the subject property and the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: the application is made by the applicant—

subparagraph.content: not later than 2 years after the date of the applicable instrument; or
not later than 2 months after the date of the conveyance on sale under which original property A is transferred or divested,

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies in relation to a person who is one of the co-buyers in respect of an applicable instrument (specified co-buyer) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property, any one of the co-buyers was a beneficial owner of another residential property in Hong Kong (original property B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the instrument is one on which—

subparagraph.content: buyer’s stamp duty has been paid; and
stamp duty has been paid according to Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1), or Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A), in the First Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The specified co-buyer may make an application for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the refund of an amount that would be the specified amount for the applicable instrument had section 29DN been applied in relation to the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the suspension of the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of such an amount.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may approve the application if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

subparagraph.leadIn: original property B is—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: transferred or divested from that co-buyer under a conveyance on sale that is executed in conformity with the agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that, had that co-buyer not been a beneficial owner of original property B on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property, the conditions in section 29DN(2) would have been met in relation to the subject property and the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: the application is made by the applicant—

subparagraph.content: not later than 2 years after the date of the applicable instrument; or
not later than 2 months after the date of the conveyance on sale under which original property B is transferred or divested,

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for the purposes of subsections (3)(a)(i)(A) and (ii) and (6)(a)(i)(A) and (ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicable instrument is a conveyance on sale—12 months after the date of the conveyance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicable instrument is an agreement for sale—12 months after the date of the conveyance on sale executed in conformity with the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is approved under subsection (3) or (6) in relation to an applicable instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount is suspended until any one of the triggering circumstances specified in section 29DU occurs in relation to the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument is to be stamped with a stamp, or by way of a stamp certificate, denoting that the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been suspended under this Subdivision.

section.name: s29DP
section.heading: Constitution of specified charges

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an applicable instrument if the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount is suspended under this Subdivision.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicable instrument is an agreement for sale, the specified amount that may be recoverable by the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the subject property was acquired by a buyer alone—constitutes an equitable charge on—

subparagraph.content: the buyer’s interest, right and title in respect of the agreement; and
the buyer’s interest, right and estate in respect of the property,

paragraph.continued: in favour of the Collector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the subject property was jointly acquired by co-buyers—constitutes an equitable charge on—

subparagraph.content: the co-buyers’ interest, right and title in respect of the agreement; and
the co-buyers’ interest, right and estate in respect of the property,

subsection.content: If the applicable instrument is a conveyance on sale, the specified amount that may be recoverable by the Collector constitutes a legal charge on the subject property in favour of the Collector.
A specified charge constituted in respect of an applicable instrument is deemed to take effect on the date of acquisition of the subject property.
If a specified charge is constituted, the Collector must make an instrument denoting it.
The instrument mentioned in subsection (5) may be registered under Cap. 128 as an instrument affecting land.

If a specified charge is an equitable charge constituted in respect of an agreement for sale under subsection (2), it is for all purposes taken to be a legal charge constituted on the subject property concerned once a conveyance on sale is executed in conformity with the agreement.

section.name: s29DQ
section.heading: Powers of Collector under specified charges

subsection.content: A specified charge confers on the Collector, as a chargee in respect of the charge, the powers in respect of the subject property concerned that are specified in Schedule 13.
The powers are not exercisable before the expiry of the specified period for the specified charge.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified period (指明期間), in relation to a specified charge, means a period of 30 days after the day on which the relevant applicable instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount ceases to be suspended under section 29DN(5)(a) or 29DO(8)(a).

section.name: s29DR
section.heading: Priority of specified charges

subsection.content: Despite any provisions in any other enactment to the contrary, a specified charge is, to the extent of the reserved amount specified in subsection (2), not entitled to priority over the first acquisition mortgage executed on the subject property concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The reserved amount specified for this section is the lower of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the sum of—

subparagraph.content: any outstanding principal in respect of the loan for acquiring the subject property under the acquisition mortgage concerned;
any outstanding interest in respect of that loan; and
any costs due under that mortgage;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amount arrived at by deducting the specified amount from the amount or value of the consideration for the acquisition of the subject property under the applicable instrument concerned.

subsection.content: Section 53 of Cap. 219 applies in relation to the specified charge as if it were a subsequent mortgage mentioned in that section.

subsection.leadIn: Moreover, for applying section 54 of Cap. 219 to any money received by the mortgagee in respect of the first acquisition mortgage mentioned in subsection (1), paragraph (d) of that section is to be disregarded, and that money is to be applied, after being applied in payment of the amounts mentioned in paragraph (c) of that section, according to the following priority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in payment of mortgage money, interest and costs due under the mortgage to the extent of the reserved amount specified in subsection (2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in payment of the specified amount secured under the specified charge; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in payment of the remaining mortgage money, interest and costs due under the mortgage.

subsection.content: Despite any rule of law, any provisions in any other enactment or any covenants, terms and conditions in any other instruments to the contrary, the priority of the specified charge in respect of the subject property is not to be affected by any right of subrogation of any person.
To avoid doubt, this section does not otherwise affect any rule of law for determining the priority of a specified charge in respect of the subject property concerned.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Cap. 219 (《第219章》) means the Conveyancing and Property Ordinance (Cap. 219);
rule of law (法律規則) means any rule of common law or of equity.

section.name: s29DS
section.heading: Meaning of deadline for waiver

subsection.leadIn: In sections 29DT, 29DU and 29DX, a reference to the deadline for waiver in relation to an applicable instrument is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the subject property was acquired by a buyer alone—the last day of the period of 9 years beginning on the first day on which the buyer is permitted to stay in Hong Kong because of the relevant specified scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the subject property was jointly acquired by co-buyers—subject to subsection (2), the last day (due day for co-buyers) of the period of 9 years beginning on the first day on which the remaining specified scheme co-buyer who, among all such co-buyers, is last permitted to stay in Hong Kong because of the relevant specified scheme, is so permitted.

subsection.content: If a co-buyer who was covered by a specified scheme on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property ceases to be a beneficial owner of the property and, as a result, the due day for co-buyers would have been advanced to a day that is earlier than the day of the cessation (cessation day), the reference to the deadline for waiver in the case of subsection (1)(b) is to be a reference to the last day of the period of 30 days after the cessation day (instead of the due day for co-buyers).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant specified scheme (相關指明計劃)—(a)in relation to a buyer, means the specified scheme by which the buyer was covered on the date of the buyer’s acquisition of the subject property; or(b)in relation to a remaining specified scheme co-buyer, means the specified scheme by which that co-buyer was covered on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property.

section.name: s29DT
section.heading: Application for waiver of liabilities in respect of specified amounts

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an applicable instrument if the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been suspended under this Subdivision.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may, on an application made by a buyer or remaining co-buyer (whichever is applicable) before the deadline for waiver, waive the liability mentioned in subsection (1) if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a buyer—

subparagraph.content: the applicant has after the date of the applicant’s acquisition of the subject property become, and on the date of the application remains, a Hong Kong permanent resident; and
no triggering circumstance specified in section 29DU(1)(a)(i) has occurred in relation to the applicable instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a remaining co-buyer—

subparagraph.content: each of the remaining co-buyers who were not Hong Kong permanent residents on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the subject property has after that date become, and on the date of the application remains, a Hong Kong permanent resident; and
no triggering circumstance specified in section 29DU(1)(a)(ii) has occurred in relation to the applicable instrument.

subsection.content: If an application is approved under subsection (2) in relation to an applicable instrument, the instrument is to be stamped with a stamp, or by way of a stamp certificate, denoting that the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been waived under this section.

section.name: s29DU
section.heading: Triggering circumstances for cessation of suspension of liabilities in respect of specified amounts

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an applicable instrument, the triggering circumstances specified for this Subdivision are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that on any date before the deadline for waiver—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the subject property was acquired by a buyer alone—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the buyer ceases to be a beneficial owner of the property; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a person other than an eligible person becomes a beneficial owner of the property in addition to the buyer; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if the subject property was jointly acquired by co-buyers—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: each of the co-buyers who were covered by a specified scheme on the date of the co-buyers’ acquisition of the property has ceased to be a beneficial owner of the property; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a person other than an eligible person becomes a beneficial owner of the property in addition to one or more remaining specified scheme co-buyers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise—that, as at the deadline for waiver, no liability has been waived under section 29DT(2) in relation to the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: eligible person (合資格人士), in relation to the subject property concerned, means a person—(a)who is closely related to—(i)for subsection (1)(a)(i)(B)—the buyer; or(ii)for subsection (1)(a)(ii)(B)—all of the remaining co-buyers; and(b)who was acting on his or her own behalf on the date of his or her acquisition of the property.

section.name: s29DV
section.heading: Payments of specified amounts

subsection.leadIn: If an applicable instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount ceases to be suspended under section 29DN(5)(a) or 29DO(8)(a), then despite section 4(3) and paragraph (C) in Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1) or paragraph (C) in Part 1 of Scale 1 of head 1(1A) (whichever is applicable) in the First Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the subject property was acquired by a buyer alone—the buyer is liable civilly to the Collector for the payment of the specified amount, and any penalty payable under subsection (3), in accordance with this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the subject property was jointly acquired by co-buyers—

subparagraph.content: the co-buyers are jointly and severally liable civilly to the Collector for the payment of the specified amount, and any penalty payable under subsection (3), in accordance with this section; and
the co-buyers may be proceeded against without reference to any civil liability of them inter se for the payment of the specified amount and penalty.

subsection.content: The specified amount must be paid to the Collector within 30 days after the day on which the relevant triggering circumstance specified in section 29DU occurred.

subsection.leadIn: If the specified amount is not paid to the Collector within the period mentioned in subsection (2) (30-day period)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a)—the buyer is liable to a penalty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)—the co-buyers are jointly and severally liable to a penalty.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of the penalty is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the specified amount is paid to the Collector later than 1 month but not later than 2 months after the expiry of the 30-day period—4 times the amount of the specified amount; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case—10 times the amount of the specified amount.

subsection.content: The Collector may remit the whole or any part of any penalty payable under subsection (3).

section.name: s29DW
section.heading: Discharge of specified charges

subsection.content: If an applicable instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount is waived on an application under section 29DT, the Collector must issue to the applicant a certificate of discharge in respect of the specified charge that has been constituted in respect of the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may also, on an application made by an eligible person, issue a certificate of discharge in respect of the specified charge to the person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the applicable instrument concerned is an agreement for sale that is unperformed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been discharged.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), a person is, in relation to an applicable instrument, an eligible person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is the buyer or any one of the remaining co-buyers (whichever is applicable);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a vendor or transferor from whom the buyer or co-buyers acquired the subject property under the instrument; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that the person otherwise has sufficient interest in making an application under that subsection in relation to the instrument.

subsection.content: The issue of a certificate of discharge under subsection (1) or (2) constitutes a discharge of the specified charge concerned.

section.name: s29DX
section.heading: Treatment of persons becoming Hong Kong permanent residents on appeal etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may, on an application made by a person who had, in relation to an applicable instrument, paid the specified amount or any penalty (or both) to the Collector because of section 29DV(1)(a), refund the amount so paid to the person if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.leadIn: had the person been a Hong Kong permanent resident on the day on which the decision was made, the conditions specified in section 29DT(2)(a) would have been met in relation to the person and the instrument on any day during the period—

subparagraph.content: beginning on the day on which the decision was made; and
ending on the day immediately before the deadline for waiver.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may, on an application made by a person who had, in relation to an applicable instrument, paid the specified amount or any penalty (or both) to the Collector because of section 29DV(1)(b), refund the amount so paid to the person if it is shown to the satisfaction of the Collector that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that co-buyer has subsequently become a Hong Kong permanent resident because of an appeal against, or any other legal proceedings concerning, the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: had that co-buyer been a Hong Kong permanent resident on the day on which the decision was made, the conditions specified in section 29DT(2)(b) would have been met in relation to the remaining co-buyers and the instrument on any day during the period—

subparagraph.content: beginning on the day on which the decision was made; and
ending on the day immediately before the deadline for waiver.

section.name: s29DY
section.heading: Admissibility etc. of applicable instruments affected by this Subdivision

subsection.content: If an applicable instrument is stamped in accordance with section 29DT(3), the instrument is admissible in evidence and available for all purposes.

If an applicable instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been suspended under this Subdivision, the instrument is admissible in evidence and available for all purposes relating to any legal proceedings that concern the acquisition of the subject property under the instrument so long as the charge instrument concerned has been registered under Cap. 128.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable instrument’s liability to stamp duty in respect of the specified amount has been suspended under this Subdivision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.content: a mortgagee exercises a power of sale in respect of the subject property under an acquisition mortgage;
the Collector exercises a power of sale in respect of the subject property under a specified charge,

subsection.continued: the instrument is admissible in evidence and available for all purposes (including proof of title) relating to the sale of the property by the mortgagee or the Collector (whichever is applicable) or any subsequent sale of the property by any other person so long as the charge instrument concerned has been registered under Cap. 128.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: charge instrument (押記文書) means an instrument made under section 29DP(5).

section.name: s29F
section.heading: Voluntary chargeable agreements for sale

subsection.content: Any chargeable agreement for sale operating as a voluntary agreement inter vivos shall be chargeable with stamp duty as a chargeable agreement for sale, with the substitution of the value of the immovable property subject to the agreement for the amount or value of the consideration for the agreement.
A chargeable agreement for sale operating as a voluntary agreement inter vivos is not duly stamped unless the Collector has stamped the instrument under section 13(3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Any chargeable agreement for sale (not being an agreement made in favour of a purchaser or incumbrancer or other person in good faith and for valuable consideration) shall for the purposes of this Ordinance be deemed to be a chargeable agreement for sale operating as a voluntary agreement inter vivos, and (except where marriage is the consideration) the consideration for any agreement for sale shall not for this purpose be deemed to be valuable consideration where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the consideration is not ascertained at the time of the agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Collector is of opinion that by reason of the inadequacy of the amount or value of the consideration paid or to be paid or other circumstances the agreement for sale confers a substantial benefit on the purchaser.
